appMap.description_en: One of he most beautiful meadows on Fruška Gora
appMap.description_rs: Jedna od najlepših livada na Fruškoj gori, nalazi se nedaleko od manastira Đipša. Svojim prizorom podseća na livade koje se nalaze na većoj nadmorskoj visini.
appMap.description_long_en: Kišelez meadow, one of the most beautiful meadows at Fruška Gora, is about 2,2km heading east, away from the turn to the Đipša monastery. The view from the monastery resembles mountain passes more than that of a meadow, but you can see sheep herding here and there, so be on the lookout for guard dogs. The view is so fantastic, we STRONGLY recommend that you go up there, stand in quiet, and just LOOK. Seriously, you don't want to miss out on this.
appMap.description_long_rs: Livada Kišelez, jedna od najlepših livada na Fruškoj gori, nalazi se na oko 2,2 kilometra od skretanja za manastir Đipša, iz pravca istoka. Pogled koji se pruža podseća na više planinske predele, a na livadi se često mogu videti ovce na ispaši, stoga obratite pažnju na pse čuvare. Pogled sa Kišeleza nikako ne smete propustiti!

appMap.description_en: <p>One of the many springs at the end of the Peka Dapevića street. It resembles a bunker from the WW II era.</p>
appMap.description_rs: Jedan od mnogobrojnih vizićkih izvora nalazi se na kraju Ulice Peke Dapevića. Svojom konstrukcijom podseća na bunker iz Drugog svetskog rata.
appMap.description_long_en: At the end of the Peka Dapčević street, on the left side before the local cemetery, there's Vrbara spring. Judging by its construction it resembles a World War II bunker. The locals often pour water from this spring, and at its base they sometimes let cattle drink from it as well. Further down the road, near the playground, is the Kamarište spring site.
appMap.description_long_rs: Na kraju Ulice Peke Dapčevića, sa leve strane pre lokalnog groblja, nalazi se izvor Vrbara, koji svojom konstrukcijom podseća na bunker iz Drugog svetskog rata. Meštani često toče vodu s ovog izvora, a u njegovom podnožju se ponekad napaja stoka. U nastavku puta, u blizini igrališta, nalazi se izvor Kamarište.

appMap.description_en: Near the Đipša monastery, there's a road that leads over the Gologuz plateau to the small fishpond at its base.
appMap.description_rs: Nedaleko od manastira Đipša nalazi se put koji vodi preko zaravni zvane Gologuz do malog ribnjaka u podnožju.
appMap.description_long_en: At 1,5km away from the crossroads that leads to the Đipša monastery, there's a road that leads over the Gologuz plateau to the small fish pond at the foot. The fish pond is private and is filled with water from a nearby spring; look for the reeds that grow at its banks to help you find it. There are a few holiday houses in the vicinity that make this place a small oasis. You may be greeted by dogs once you arrive. They're almost always friendly, but keep an eye out anyway.
appMap.description_long_rs: Na nekih 1,5 kilometara od raskrsnice za manastir Đipša, na rubu šume, nalazi se put koji vodi preko zaravni zvane Gologuz do malog ribnjaka u podnožju. Ribnjak je u privatnom vlasništvu i puni se iz obližnjeg izvora. Ribnjak se može nazreti po trski koja je izrasla pored. Nekoliko vikendica koje se nalaze u okolini čine ovo mesto pravom malom oazom. Možda će vas dočekati psi, najčešće umiljati, ali svakako obratite pažnju.

appMap.description_en: The spring site that's 1,4km away from Zmajevac towards Rakovac is a popular destination because it's close to the road.
appMap.description_rs: Izvor koji se nalazi na 1,4 km od izletišta Zmajevac putem prema Rakovcu popularna je destinacija za posetioce zbog neposredne blizine puta.
appMap.description_long_en: This spring is 1,4km away from the Zmajevac resort towards Rakovac. The spring site is built in stone. Because it's close to the main road this spring site is very popular. Its only flaw is that sometimes, during great summer heat waves, it tends to dry out. A little further out from the site you'll find the turn to the Rakovac quarry.
appMap.description_long_rs: Ovaj izvor se nalazi na 1,4 kilometra od izletišta Zmajevac putem prema Rakovcu. Izvorište je ozidano kamenom. Baš zbog neposredne blizine puta ovaj izvor je veoma popularan za posetioce. Jedina mana mu je što se u vreme velikih vrućina dešava da presuši. Nedaleko od izvora se nalazi skretanje za Rakovački kamenolom.

appMap.description_en: The smallest reservoir at Fruška Gora is deep within the forest near the Vizić village. It's filled by the local spring and groundwater.
appMap.description_rs: Najmanje veštačko jezero na Fruškoj gori smešteno duboko u šumi blizu sela Vizić. Pune ga obližnji izvor i podzemne vode.
appMap.description_long_en: The smallest reservoir at Fruška Gora is deep within the forest near the Vizić village. It's filled by the local spring and groundwater. It was once used for irrigation but now it's more of a small getaway, well known by the locals. You won't be able to swim or fish because of the lake's size and reeds. The way to the lake is both quiet, eerie, and majestic - the abandonded summer houses lie in ruin, overgrowing with abundant plant life; serving as silent mementos of a once vibrant and colourful past.
appMap.description_long_rs: Najmanje veštačko jezero na Fruškoj gori smešteno je duboko u šumi blizu sela Vizić. Pune ga obližnji izvor i podzemne vode. Nekada je služilo za navodnjavanje, a sada više ima svrhu malog izletišta. Za njega mahom znaju meštani Vizića. Na ovom mestu nećete moći da pecate i plivate jer veličina jezera i trska to ne omogućavaju. Put do jezerceta ostavlja nesvakidašnji utisak – priroda i napuštene vikendice ukazuju na nekadašnju živost ovog mesta koje se sada prepustilo tišini prirode.

appMap.description_en: At the end of the Vizić village, by way of the dirt road that passes a playground, lies the Kamarište spring at the end of a local farmer's field.
appMap.description_rs: Na kraju sela Vizić u pravcu zemljanog puta koji vodi pored igrališta a u dnu njive lokalnog zemljoposednika nalazi se izvor Kamarište.
appMap.description_long_en: At the end of the Vizić village, right after the Vrbara spring, in the same direction as the dirt road that passes a playground, there's a spring flowing out of a local farmer's field. A walnut tree that looms not far from the road can be used as a landmark to find your way. The spring itself isn't regulated. However, there's an overflowing and budding plant life that handles droughts better thanks to the moist soil.
appMap.description_long_rs: Na kraju sela Vizić, odmah posle izvora Vrbara, u pravcu zemljanog puta koji vodi pored igrališta a u dnu njive lokalnog zemljoposednika izvire voda iz zemlje. Kao orijentir može poslužiti orah koji se nazire s puta i pod čijom krošnjom je izvor. Kamarište nije uređeno. Zbog vlažnosti zemljišta okolna vegetacija je bujnija i lakše podnosi sušu.

appMap.description_en: The monastery was, according to legend, built by a chamberlain of despot Jovan Branković called Raka in the XV century, at the same spot where he shot a deer.
appMap.description_rs: Manastir je po predanju podigao izvesni Raka, komornik despota Jovana Brankovića, u XV veku na mestu gde je ubio jelena, a posvećen je Svetom Kuzmi i Damjanu.
appMap.description_long_en:
This women's monastery is snugged cosily in the northern part of Fruška Gora, right beside the Rakovac stream, and next to the main road that goes through Rakovac. It's dedicated to st. Kuzma and Damian. Legend has it, it was raised by a certain man called Raka, a chamberlain of despot Jovan Branković, at the end of the fifteenth century, on a spot where he killed a deer.

The renovated, massive dormitories that surround the monastery hide this charming place from passers-by. The monastery was destroyed numerous times during its history, as well as pillaged by Turks, Austrohungarians, and Germans. Thus, the architecture of the place changed with each renovation. 

This monastery was, too, damaged greatly during World War II. Before the war, a huge baroque bell tower and a dome rose high above the dormitories. They, along with the church were heavily ruined, and the bell tower was destroyed once the germans found out there was a partisan printing press in it. The dome has been renovated and resembles roman architecture, whilst the bell tower is not even close to the one that stood before.

If you're planing on visiting, take the time to explore other spots in Rakovac.
appMap.description_long_rs:
Ovaj ženski manastir je smešten u podnožju severnog dela Fruške gore, odmah uz Rakovački potok, a neposredno pored glavnog puta koji vodi kroz Rakovac. Posvećen je Svetom Kuzmi i Damjanu, a po predanju, podigao ga je izvesni Raka, komornik despota Jovana Brankovića, krajem XV veka na mestu gde je ubio jelena.

Renovirani masivni konaci koji opasuju manastir kao da skrivaju ovaj mali nadasve šarmantni manastir od prolaznika. Kako je manastir tokom svoje istorije više puta razaran i pljačkan od Turaka, Austrougara i Nemaca, tako se i arhitektura manastira menjala.

Ovaj manastir nije zaobišao ni Drugi svetski rat, kada je pretrpeo velika oštećenja. Pre rata iza konaka su se uzdizali visoki barokni zvonik i kupola. Crkva i konaci su teško oštećeni, a zvonik je porušen kada su Nemci saznali da se u manastiru nalazi partizanska štamparija. Sada je kupola renovirana i podseća na romanički stil gradnje, dok zvonik nije ni približan onom nekadašnjem.

Ako planirate da posetite manastir, odvojite vreme da obiđete i ostale rakovačke lokacije.

appMap.description_en: The Vrdnička Ravanica is the only monastery in a populated area. With a rich historical heritage it enriches this small place at the foot of Fruška Gora.
appMap.description_rs: Vrdnička Ravanica jedini je manastir koji se nalazi u naseljenom mestu. Sa bogatim istorijskim nasleđem obogaćuje ovo malo mesto u podnožju Fruške gore.
appMap.description_long_en:
Vrdnik is known for it's spa centre at the southern slopes of Fruška Gora. Coincidentally, that also happens to be where the Vrdnik monastery is. This is the only monastery that's at a populated area. It's believed that it has been raised during the sixteenth century. Little was known about it until the monks from the Ravanica monastery settled in, because they were running away from the Turks during the Great Serb Migration. They built a church and dedicated it to the Ascension of Christ, but they've also been calling it Mala Ravanica. they brought with them relics of Prince Lazar, which remained there until 1942, when they were transferred to the Cathedral in Belgrade. They were returned in 1989. The monastery today is being kept up by female monks, and the dormitories are considered one of the most beautiful at Frušta Gora.

During World War II the monastery hadn't suffered much damage, but priceless artifacts from the monastery's treasury were stolen, only to be later return to the SPC museum in Belgrade.

If you take the road to Ruma, at 8km away from this place is the Pavlovačko lake, and a couple more away is the Borkovačko lake. There're also the Jazak and Mala Remeta monasteries nearby.
appMap.description_long_rs:
U mestu Vrdnik, poznatom banjskom centru na južnim padinama Fruške gore, nalazi se manastir Vrdnik. Ovo je jedini fruškogorski manastir koji se nalazi u naseljenom mestu. Smatra se da je podignut tokom XVI veka. O njemu se malo toga znalo sve dok ga nisu naselili monasi manastira Ravanica bežeći pred Turcima tokom Velike seobe Srba. Sagradili su crkvu i posvetili je Vaznesenju Hristovom, i od tada ovaj manastir nazivaju i Mala Ravanica. Sa sobom su doneli mošti kneza Lazara koje su tu ležale sve do 1942, kada su bile prenete u Sabornu crkvu u Beogradu i tek 1989. vraćene u svoju zadužbinu. Danas se o manastiru staraju monahinje, a konaci manastira su ubrajaju u jedne od najlepših na Fruškoj gori.

U Drugom svetskom ratu manastir nije pretrpeo veća oštećenja, ali su pokradeni dragoceni predmeti iz manastirske riznice koji su kasnije vraćeni u muzej SPC u Beogradu.

Ako krenete putem ka Rumi, na samo osam kilometara odavde, nalazi se Pavlovačko jezero, a koji kilometar dalje i Borkovačko. U blizini se još nalaze i manastiri Jazak i Mala Remeta.

appMap.description_en: A favoruite picnic destination for people living in Divoš and nearby villages, with a view of the Srem plains. The Kuveždin and Đipša monasteries are close by.
appMap.description_rs: Omiljeno je izletište meštana Divoša i okolnih sela odakle se pruža lep pogled na sremsku ravnicu. Nedaleko odavde nalaze se manastiri Kuveždin i Đipša.
appMap.description_long_en:
The Rohalj Bases picnic area got its name from the underground bases, ie. the hiding place of the local residents that fled from Divoš, Ležimir and other villages nearby during World War 2. The shelters were placed at the then-owned land of family Rohalj from Divoš, so that's how it got the first part of its name. This is where the partisan squads were hiding in dugouts, so this place was a freed zone. Right by the road is the monument-house, raised in 1972, where National Liberation War's exhibits were displayed. Today it's abandoned and most of the exhibits were transferred to the Srem Museum in Semska Mitrovica. Not far away from the house, by way of a small brick rode, is the monument-graveyard dedicated to the victims of the war.

This location today is a favourite picnic spot of locals from Divoš and nearby villages. Spending a night in the nearby forest during the 1. May holiday is especially popular. There are a lot of mountain springs in the vicinity. A few kilometres away is the Kuveždin and Đipša, and there's a lovely view from the slopes, from where you can see the Divoš village and the Srem plains. During a clear day you can even see the mountains Cer and Majevica.
appMap.description_long_rs:
Rohalj baze su dobile naziv po podzemnim bazama, odnosno skrovištima lokalnog stanovništva koje se povlačilo iz Divoša, Ležimira i okolnih sela za vreme Drugog svetskog rata. Skloništa su bila smeštena na tadašnjem posedu divoške porodice Rohalj, pa otuda prvi deo naziva. Na ovom mestu su bili stacionirani partizanski odredi sakriveni u zemunicama, tako da je tokom rata ova lokacija bila slobodna teritorija. Odmah pokraj puta se nalazi spomen-kuća, podignuta 1972, u kojoj su bili izloženi eksponati NOB-a. Danas je napuštena i veći deo eksponata je prenet u Muzej Srema u Sremskoj Mitrovici. Nedaleko od spomen-kuće, u pravcu stazice popločane kaldrmom, nalazi se spomen-groblje posvećeno žrtvama u ratu.

Ova lokacija je danas omiljeno izletište meštana iz Divoša i drugih okolnih sela, a naročito su popularna noćenja u okolnoj šumi za vreme prvomajskih praznika. U blizini se nalazi veći broj planinskih izvora. Na svega nekoliko kilometara se nalaze manastiri Kuveždin i Đipša, a sa padina se pruža lep pogled na selo Divoš i sremsku ravnicu. Po vedrom danu u daljini se jasno vide planine Cer i Majevica.

appMap.description_en: A monumental site, made as a mosaic, dedicated to the fallen soldiers and victimes in WW2, sits beside a road that leads to Zmajevac.
appMap.description_rs: Monumentalno obeležje, napravljeno kao mozaik, posvećeno je palim borcima i žrtvama u II svetskom ratu i nalazi se kraj puta koji vodi ka izletištu Zmajevac.
appMap.description_long_en:
This memorial site is dedicated to fallen soldiers and victims of the fascist regime that died during World War 2 on the territory of Rakovac. It's about 500m away from the monastery, next to a road that leads to the Zmajevac picnic area. During the war, Rakovac was a strong foothold of the rebelion where armerd actions were taken against the ocupator. As a sign of retaliation in 1942. the village was burned  and the price of war was payed by the monastery as well, where a partisan printing press was discovered in 1943. The central green plateau is surrounded by monumental memorial plaques. One part of the complex was built inside the hill itself, and it remembers a mine shaft. It actually made as a mosaic, and up until a while ago, a huge portrait of Tito loomed high with the tag line "Comrade Tito, we swear to you" that was recently painted over. 

Right above the complex is the Beli Majdan cave, to which you can arrive by a forest road.
appMap.description_long_rs:
Ovo spomen-obeležje je posvećeno palim borcima i žrtvama fašizma koji su stradali tokom Drugog svetskog rata na teritoriji Rakovca. Nalazi se na oko 500 metara od manastira kraj puta koji vodi ka izletištu Zmajevac. Tokom rata Rakovac je bio jako uporište oslobodilačkog pokreta odakle su preduzimane oružane akcije protiv okupatora. U znak odmazde 1942. godine selo je spaljeno, a cenu rata platio je i manastir u kome je otkrivena partizanska štamparija 1943. godine.
Centralni zeleni plato je okružen monumentalnim spomen-pločama. Jedan deo kompleksa je napravljen u samom brdu i podseća na rudarsko okno. Karakterističan je po tome što je napravljen iz mozaika, a doskora je tu bio i Titov veliki portret sa natpisom „Druže Tito, mi ti se kunemo”, koji je prekrečen.

Odmah iznad spomen-kompleksa nalazi se pećina Beli Majdan do koje možete doći šumskim putem.

appMap.description_en: A lake, that spreads the length of the Jarkovci village, is home to diverse animal species, and at its bank is count Pajačević's summer house.
appMap.description_rs: Jezero, koje se proteže duž sela Jarkovci, dom je različitim vrstama životinja, a na samoj obali je letnjikovac grofa Pajačevića koji upotpunjuje ceo ambijent.
appMap.description_long_en:
Lake Ljukovo, the artificial accumulation better known as Jarkovačko lake, follows the village Jarkovci at the southern slopes of Fruška Gora. It formed in 1977. when the stream was cut off, in hopes of irrigating local farmland. It's 300m wide and 2km long. It's a popular destination of sport fishermen all year round (except the fish spawning period), and especially for those seeking refuge from the great heat during summer. Because of its natural surroundings, it's become a home for many types of animals that enrich the scenery of this lake.

At the end of the village, at the very bank of the lake, is the summer house of count Pajačević that was built during the twentieth century, and presents a unique attraction for all visitors in the neighborhood. 

On the other side is, what the locals call, the Jarkovci spring.
appMap.description_long_rs:
Duž sela Jarkovci, na južnim padinama Fruške gore, proteže se jezero Ljukovo, veštačka akumulacija poznatija i kao Jarkovačko jezero. Nastalo je 1977. godine pregrađivanjem potoka sa ciljem navodnjavanja okolnih useva, širine je oko 300 metara i dužine dva kilometra, a zahvata površinu od 35 hektara. Tokom cele godine, sem za vreme mresta ribe, popularna je destinacija sportskih ribolovaca, a tokom leta i svih onih koji traže spas od velikih vrućina. Zbog svog prirodnog okruženja postalo je dom mnogobrojnim vrstama životinja koje ulepšavaju sliku ovog jezera.

Na kraju sela, na samoj obali jezera, nalazi se i letnjikovac grofa Pajačevića koji je izgrađen početkom XX veka i predstavlja svojevrsnu atrakciju za sve koji se nađu u ovom kraju.

Sa druge strane brane nalazi se izvor koji meštani nazivaju Jarkovački.

appMap.description_en: Near the Đipša monastery lies a road that leads over the Gologuz plateau to a spring in its foot.
appMap.description_rs: Nedaleko od manastira Đipša nalazi se put koji vodi preko zaravni zvane Gologuz do izvora u podnožju.
appMap.description_long_en: At about 1,5km awayfrom the crossroad to Đipša monastery, at the edge of the forest, you'll find a road that leads over the Gologuz plateau straight to a small fishpond at its foot. The fishpond is private and is filled with water from a local spring, which you can find by looking for the reeds that grows near it. The walled spring spot flows in the shade of a tall willow tree. The spring happens to dry out during great summer heat waves.
appMap.description_long_rs: Na nekih 1,5 kilometara od raskrsnice za manastir Đipša, na rubu šume, nalazi se put koji vodi preko zaravni zvane Gologuz do malog ribnjaka u podnožju. Ribnjak je u privatnom vlasništvu i puni se iz obližnjeg izvora, koji se može nazreti po trski koja je izrasla pored, a ozidano izvorište je smešteno u hladu velike vrbe. Tokom velikih vrućina dešava se da izvor presuši.

appMap.description_en: It's on top of a lonely hill, overgrown with thick forest, and has been vigilantly overlooking Vrdnik for a long, long time.
appMap.description_rs: Nalazi se na vrhu usamljenog brda obraslog gustom šumom i motri na Vrdnik već duži niz godina.
appMap.description_long_en:
The Vrdnik Tower is, believe it or not, near Vrdnik. There's reason to believe that its foundations were raised during Roman times in the fourth century, upon which a fort was later built in the fourteenth century. Today's tower, however, is only a shadow of the one that once was. 

It's at the top of a lonely hill, overgrown with thick forest, so it'll always be on your horizon wherever you're coming from. There's a winding mountain path that leads to the tower - to get to it, look for the sign that reads "Kula - Staza Zdravlja." After a few minutes of climbing (and it shouldn't be too hard) you'll end up at the oval walls of the tower. It's a few meters shy of being 20m tall, and is cylindrically shaped. There are openings in its thick walls through which, if you're good at climbing, you'll be able to see inside. The view of the forests of Fruška Gora from up there is highly inspiring, and utmost impressive.

The forest around it hides remnants of the former walls of the fort. On your way back you could come down the way to Vrdnik and the Ravanica monastery.
appMap.description_long_rs:
Nalazi se u blizini Vrdnika. Postoje saznanja da su temelji kule izgrađeni još za vreme Rimljana u IV veku, a posle je na tim istim temeljima izgrađeno utvrđenje u XIV veku. Današnja kula predstavlja ostatak tog nekadašnjeg utvrđenja.

Nalazi se na vrhu usamljenog brda obraslog gustom šumom, tako da će vam se uvek nalaziti na horizontu bez obzira na to iz kog pravca dolazite. Do kule vodi vijugava planinska staza na koju vas upućuje tabla sa natpisom „Kula – Staza zdravlja”. Nakon nekoliko minuta aktivnog penjanja, koje ne bi trebalo da bude previše naporno, dospećete direktno do ovalnih zidina kule.

Kula je nešto niža od 20 metara i cilindričnog je oblika. Postoje otvori u debelim zidinama kroz koje, ako ste vešti u penjanju, možete da osmotrite unutrašnjost. Pogled na fruškogorske šume koje se pružaju u nedogled je impresivan.  

U šumi okolo nalaze se ostaci nekadašnjih zidina utvrđenja. Po povratku, možete se spustiti putem ka Vrdniku i manastiru Ravanica.

appMap.description_en: The main crossroad at the Vizić village is also where the Dolina spring is, too. From this beautiful, walled fountain water flows even during droughts.
appMap.description_rs: Na glavnoj raskrsnici u selu Vizić nalazi se izvor Dolina. Iz lepe, ozidane česme voda teče u jakom mlazu, čak i u vreme najvećih suša.
appMap.description_long_en: The main crossroad at the Vizić village happens to be where Dolina springs is, too. From this beautiful, walled fountain water vigorously flows during even the most unforgiving droughts. The locals say that if all the springs dried out, Dolina would resist and water would still flow from its depths. The real source of the spring is on top of a hill above the fountain, from where it trickles down naturally.
appMap.description_long_rs: Na glavnoj raskrsnici u selu Vizić nalazi se izvor Dolina. Iz lepe ozidane česme voda teče u jakom mlazu, čak i u vreme najvećih suša. Meštani kažu da, kada bi svi fruškogorski izvori presušili, Dolina bi se održala. Pravo izvorište se nalazi na brdu iznad, a voda se prirodnim padom sliva ka česmi.

appMap.description_en: At the far eastern part of Fruška Gora lies the Velika Remeta monastery. The diverse selection of scenery attracts more and more visitors.
appMap.description_rs: Na krajnjem istočnom delu Fruške gore nalazi se manastir Velika Remeta. Različitosti koje nudi ovaj manastir zasigurno privlači sve više ljudi.
appMap.description_long_en:
At the far eastern part of Fruška gora, a few hundred meters from the Šelovrenac stream, is the Velika Remeta monastery. According to legend, it was founded by king Dragutin during the end of the thirteenth century. It was first mentioned in official historical scriptures in the sixteenth century. The men's monastery is devoted to St. Dimitrije, and is completely surrounded by dormitories. In its center is the highest bell tower - 38,6m - in Srem.

The moment you set foot on monastery grounds, you'll be enchanted by the heaven's garden of iguman Stefan. On its left is a small ethnic village with a few log cabins and summer houses perfect for people who just want to set up a good grill and relax, enjoying the scenic nature. On its right is the replica of the Bethelem cave and Sion hills with a chapel. There's also the Ubavac spring, famous for it's eyesight-sharpening and healing waters. Because of all these things, this hidden monastery in a valley far off-road, is gaining in popularity and is visited more and more by those who enjoy a soft summer's breeze in peace. 

During WW2 the monastery was burnt to the ground, and its treasury pillaged in great extent.
appMap.description_long_rs:
Na krajnjem istočnom delu Fruške gore, svega nekoliko stotina metara od izvorišta potoka Šelovrenca, nalazi se manastir Velika Remeta. Prema predanju, osnovao ga je kralj Dragutin krajem XIII veka, a u zvaničnim istorijskim spisima se prvi put pominje u XVI veku. Manastir je muški i posvećen je Svetom Dimitriju. Sa sve četiri strane okružen je konacima, a u središtu se izdiže najviši zvonik u Sremu visine 38,6 metara.

Kad kročite na manastirski posed, očaraće vas rajski vrt igumana Stefana. Odmah sa leve strane se nalazi malo etno-selo sa nekoliko brvnara i letnjikovac koji su tu napravljeni za sve ljude koji žele da roštiljaju i uživaju u prirodi. Sa desne strane manastira je izgrađena i replika Vitlejemske pećine i brda Sion sa kapelom. Tu se još nalazi i izvor Ubavac, koji je čuven po vodi koja bistri vid. Zbog svega toga ovaj skriveni manastir u dolini daleko od puteva danas posećuje sve više ljudi koji žele da uživaju u prirodi.

U toku Drugog svetskog rata manastir je spaljen, a manastirska riznica većim delom pokradena.

U blizini se nalaze i manastiri Grgeteg i Krušedol.

appMap.description_en: Koruška is near the Susek village at Danube's bank, popular among local fishermen.
appMap.description_rs: Koruška se nalazi u blizini sela Susek na obali Dunava, popularno mesto lokalnih pecaroša.
appMap.description_long_en: The Koruška rest area is near the Susek village. If you're coming from Novi Sad or Sviloš, you'll see a road sign that points to this place. Because it's on the Danube's bank, it's popular among loal fishermen. Should you decide to take a walk down the Danube bank during warm days, chances are you'll see swimmers too, and more often than not, you'll see small islands formed by the tide. This also happens to be the spot with the most popular fish restaurant, with a great view of the Danube from its terrace.
appMap.description_long_rs: Odmaralište Koruška se nalazi u blizini sela Susek. Ukoliko dolazite iz pravca Novog Sada ili Sviloša, videćete putokaz koji upućuje na ovo mesto. Pošto se nalazi na obali Dunava, popularno je mesto lokalnih pecaroša. Ukoliko prošetate dunavskom obalom, možete u toplim periodima sresti i kupače, a često se mogu videti mala ostrva formirana povlačenjem vode sa razuđene obale. Ovde se nalazi i popularni riblji restoran sa terasom koji ima pogled na Dunav.

appMap.description_en: Isolated and surrounded by a pine forest, the Staro Hopovo monastery is surely one of the smallest and most memorable at Fruška Gora.
appMap.description_rs: Izolovan i okružen borovom šumom, manastir Staro Hopovo zasigurno je jedan od najmanjih i najupečatljivijih na Fruškoj gori.
appMap.description_long_en:
About 2km away from the Novo Hopovo monastery is the Staro Hopovo men's monastery. It's surrounded by a forest predominantly made up of pine trees, and is surely the smallest of the monasteries on Fruška Gora. At the end of the fifteenth and the beginning of the sixteenth century, despot Đorđe Branković had raised the monastery and built the church devoted to St. Nikola. Sadly, nothing remains of the church, which was made from wood and tiles, because it was decimated during an earthquake. In its place now stands today's church, devoted to St. Panteleimon. 

The church was partially damaged during World War II; the dormitories destroyed, and the iconostasis partially burnt.

If you continue down the road next to the monastery, you'll arrive straight to the Jelenac stream and spring, above which stands a small chapel. East of the monastery are the Grgeteg and Mala Remeta monasteries.
appMap.description_long_rs:
Na oko dva kilometra od manastira Novo Hopovo, izolovan i okružen borovom šumom, nalazi se muški manastir Staro Hopovo, zasigurno jedan od najmanjih na Fruškoj gori. Često se naziva i Stari manastir. Krajem XV i početkom XVI veka despot Đorđe Branković podiže manastir i gradi crkvu posvećenu Svetom Nikoli.

Od te stare crkve, koja je bila sagrađena od drveta i pokrivena crepom, nije ostalo gotovo ništa. Pošto je stradala pod udarom zemljotresa, sredinom XVIII veka, umesto nje niče današnja crkva posvećena Svetom Pantelejmonu.

Za vreme Drugog svetskog rata crkva manastira je delimično oštećena, konak razrušen, a ikonostas delimično izgoreo.

Ako nastavite putićem pored manastira, stići ćete pravo do potoka Jelenac, izvora Staro Hopovo nad kojim je podignuta mala kapela i Sumpornog izvora. Istočno od njega nalaze se manastiri Grgeteg i Mala Remeta.

appMap.description_en: Near the Staro Hopovo monastery lies the spring above which sits a small rustic stone chapel.
appMap.description_rs: Nedaleko do manastira Staro Hopovo nalazi se izvor iznad kog je napravljena rustična kapelica od kamena.
appMap.description_long_en: About 200m away from Staro Hopovo monastery, through the woods, lies the spring that bears the same name. There's a stone chapel above the spring, and it's said that it has healing waters. This place is especially interesting because only 40m away, by crossing the "bridge" over Jelenac stream, there's a spring of sulforic water that's not recommended for drinking.
appMap.description_long_rs: Na nekih 200 metara od manastira Staro Hopovo putem kroz šumu nalazi se istoimeni izvor. Iznad izvora je napravljena kapelica od kamena, a za ovu vodu još kažu da je lekovita. Ovo mesto zavređuje posebnu pažnju jer samo 40 metara dalje, „mostićem” preko potoka Jelenac, nalazi se izvor sumporne vode koja se ne preporučuje za piće.

appMap.description_en: A regulated spring Zvečan is on the road towards the Ledinci lake. The forest path from the spring leads to the beautiful viewpoint of the lake.
appMap.description_rs: Uređeni izvor Zvečan nalazi se na putu ka Ledinačkom jezeru. Šumskim putem od izvora dolazi se do prelepog vidikovca na jezero.
appMap.description_long_en: If you go by the road to the Ledinci lake, you'll stumble upon the built Zvečan spring. Because of its popularity, many people from Novi Sad and local places often come here for water. Further on, the forest road leads you to the viewpoint where you can see all of the Ledinci lake.
appMap.description_long_rs: Ako krenete putem prema Ledinačkom jezeru, naići ćete na uređeni izvor Zvečan. Zbog popularnosti ovog izvora veoma često ljudi iz Novog Sada i okolnih mesta dolaze ovde da toče vodu. Dalje šumskim putem možete doći do vidikovca Ledinačkog jezera.

appMap.description_en: Perinac spring is in the lively albeit small village Stara Bingula, at the end of the main street. Although it's in private property entrance is allowed.
appMap.description_rs: Izvor Perinac se nalazi u živopisnom fruškogorskom seocetu Stara Bingula, na kraju ulice duž sela. Iako je na privatnom posedu, prolaz do izvora je dozvoljen.
appMap.description_long_en: Perinac is a spring site located in the small village called Stara Bingula. In this lively and multicultural village live Ruthenians, Serbs, Croats and Slovaks. At the end of the main street of the village, about 200m in, there's a spring built on private property where entrance is allowed. The spring itself isn't that built at all, and the excess water accumulates in a small pond below it. The colorful houses that fill this village give it a special touch.
appMap.description_long_rs: Perinac je izvor koji se nalazi u malom fruškogorskom selu Stara Bingula. U ovom živopisnom i mutikulturalnom seocetu žive u slozi Rusini, Srbi, Hrvati i Slovaci. Na kraju ulice duž sela, na nekih 200 metara, nalazi se izvor na privatnom posedu gde je ulaz dozvoljen. Izvor nije posebno uređen, a višak vode se akumulira u malenoj bari ispod izvora. Poseban utisak ostavljaju simpatične koloritne kuće kojima je protkano ovo predivno selo.

appMap.description_en: One of the most beautiful lakes on Fruška Gora, fish rich and with a vivid landscape is near Sot, about 10km away from Šid
appMap.description_rs: Jedno od najlepših jezera Fruškogorja, živopisnog pejzaža i bogato ribom, nalazi se u blizini mesta Sot, na oko 10 km od Šida.
appMap.description_long_en:
At the western part of Fruška Gora, near Sot, and about ten kilometres away from Šid, there's the Sot lake. This artificial accumulated lake was made in the eighties, is 33ha big and about 4m deep, and it belongs to the Fruška Gora national park. The beautiful, scenic nature puts it at the top of the most beautiful lakes on Fruška Gora. At the beach on the right is a small weekend-village with a few houses, and on the left side is a boat with a small house and a few docks. This vivid landscape is completed with willow trees and the encompassing forest.

The lake lures not only weekenders and swimmers, but fishermen too, who happen to be regular guests here because the lake is teeming with fish.

If by any chance you have your passport, you can take a shortcut through Croatia and visit a small place called Ljuba which has numerous springs, and Erdevk lakes.
appMap.description_long_rs:
Na najzapadnijem delu Fruške gore, pokraj mesta Sot a na samo desetak kilometara od Šida, nalazi se Sotsko jezero. Ova veštačka akumulacija nastala je 80-ih godina, površine 33 hektara i dubine od oko četiri metra, i pripada Nacionalnom parku Fruška gora.

Prelep prirodni ambijent ga svrstava u jedno od najlepših fruškogorskih jezera. Na desnoj obali se nalazi malo vikend-naselje sa nekoliko kuća, a na levoj drveni splav sa kućicom i nekoliko dokova. Ovaj živopisni pejzaž upotpunjen je vrbama i šumom koja ga opasuje.

Jezero ne mami samo vikendaše i kupače, nego i ribolovce koji su ovde redovni gosti jer je jezero izuzetno bogato ribom.

Ako kojim slučajem imate pasoš kod sebe, možete napraviti prečicu kroz Hrvatsku i posetiti mesto Ljuba u kome se nalaze brojni izvori, a zatim i Erdevička jezera.

appMap.description_en: At the crossroad between Partisan rode and the Ležimir-Sviloš road is the "medicinal magnetic field" site which is believed to cure diseases.
appMap.description_rs: Na raskrsnici kod Partizanskog puta i puta Ležimir–Sviloš nalazi se izvor ‚‚lekovitog magnetnog zračenja” za koje se veruje da utiče na lečenje raznih bolesti.
appMap.description_long_en:
No, it's not a spring site, it's a "medical magnetic radiation" site. It was discovered by Sofija Milanović and, as she claims, this site has special magnetic fields that positively affect the nervous system, and heal other diseases. All you have to do is enter the field, close your eyes for 20 minutes and let go, embracing the "field effect." Since 2011. more and more people have been gathering at this spot, and in their thanks they hang small pictures of saints on a tree within the field. Some of the key words that describe this place are saints, churches, Egyptian pyramids, power, light, so it all points to mysticism. 

Some say the field helped them, and it's up to you to figure out if it's a plain placebo effect or something real. We haven't found any evidence that the field exists, though.

The site is on the crossroad between Partisan road and Ležimir-Sviloš road.
appMap.description_long_rs:
Ne, nije reč o izvoru vode, nego o izvoru „lekovitog magnetnog zračenja”. Otkrila ga je Sofija Milanović i, kako kaže, ovo mesto poseduje lekovita magnetna polja čime povoljno utiče na centralni nervni sistem i lečenje raznih bolesti. Jedino što treba da uradite jeste da uđete u krug polja, zatvorite oči na 20 minuta i prepustite se „uticaju zračenja”. Od 2011. godine ljudi se u većem broju skupljaju na tom mestu i u znak zahvalnosti kače male ikone svetaca na drvo unutar polja. Neki od pojmova koji se vezuju za ovo mesto su sveci, crkve, egipatske piramide, moć, svetlost, tako da sve upućuje na misticizam.

Kako kažu, nekim ljudima je pomoglo, a na vama je da proverite da li je to placebo efekat ili zaista postoji neko dejstvo, mada mi nismo našli nijedan egzaktan dokaz koji govori o njegovom postojanju.

Mesto se nalazi na raskrsnici Partizanskog puta i puta Ležimir–Sviloš.

appMap.description_en: Međeš lake, near Šatrinci, with its beach, volleyball field, table tennis, and small restaurant is a fine place for some rest and relaxation.
appMap.description_rs: Jezero Međeš, u blizini Šatrinaca, sa plažom i terenom za odbojku i stoni tenis, kao i malim restoranom, pogodno je mesto za odmor i rekreaciju.
appMap.description_long_en:
Međeš lake, also known as Šatrinačko lake, was formed by water accumulation after the damn on the Međeš stream was built, so that the big and famous orchard nearby could be irrigated. It's on the southern slopes of Fruška Gora near Šatrinci, and somewhat away from Irig. Four to five feet deep and 48ha across, the lake reaches depths of 12 feet at some points. The lake is rich with fish and this blue visage is heaven for sport fishermen, who you'll be able to see throughout the year. 

In the warm monthrs the lake turns into a small refuge area for nature lovers. There's a bigger beach (made out of gravels thrown on the banks) with showers. A volleyball field on sand is nearby, as well as table tennis, and there's a restaurant where you can get something to eat and drink, too. The lake is privately owned, as well as the Šelovrenac lake, but it's urbanised and walled off, so it's open to everyone. 

About five kilometres north of the lake is the Krušedol monastery, and a fre kilometres south is the Dobrodol lake.
appMap.description_long_rs:
Jezero Međeš, poznatije kao Šatrinačko jezero, nastalo je akumulacijom vode nakon podizanja brane na potoku Međeš za potrebe navodnjavanja nekada velikog i poznatog voćnjaka. Nalazi se na južnoj padini Fruške gore u blizini mesta Šatrinci i nedaleko od Iriga. Površina mu je oko 48 hektara, a dubina oko 4-5 metara, s tim što na nekim mestima doseže i do 12 metara. Jezero je bogato ribom i zato je ovo plavo prostranstvo raj za sportske ribolovce kojih ima tokom cele godine.

U toplim mesecima se pretvara u pravo malo odmaralište za sve zaljubljenike u prirodu. Postoji jedna veća plaža sa tuševima koja je posuta šljunkom samo po obali. Pored se nalazi teren za odbojku na pesku i stoni tenis, kao i mali restoran u kome možete nešto da popijete i pojedete. I ovo jezero se nalazi u rukama privatnika kao i jezero Šelovrenac, s tim što ovo nije toliko urbanizovano i nije ograđeno, pa je pristup jezeru slobodan za sve.

Na oko pet kilometara severno od jezera nalazi se manastir Krušedol, a par kilometara južnije i jezero Dobrodol.

appMap.description_en: The quarry was founded in 1937. with the exploitation of trachyte, a volcanic rock, and represents a scar on the face of Fruska Gora.
appMap.description_rs: Kamenolom osnovan 1937. sa ciljem eksploatacije trahita – kamena eruptivnog porekla, predstavlja ožiljak na licu Fruške gore usled negativnog uticaja na prirodu
appMap.description_long_en:
Quarry Rakovac was founded in 1937 when the exploitation of trachyte, a volcanic rock, began. The deepest point of the excavation was reached in the 70's and after more than 70 years of exploitation the mine's lifetime is coming to an end. This location is also known as the surface mine Kišnjeva glava.

The big surface mine represents a scar on the face of Fruska Gora and is definitely not worthy of being in the national park. The decades of rock exploitation left deadly consequences on the natural environment. According to the new national regulations and world standards, the mines must be closed through the recultivation of the terrain and must be integrated in the scenery and ambient of the national park.This process is yet to be started.

The surface mine is located around two kilometers from Partisan road and can also be reached when coming from Rakovac.
appMap.description_long_rs:
Kamenolom Rakovac je osnovan 1937. godine kada je započeta eksploatacija trahita – kamena eruptivnog porekla. Najveći obim iskopavanja je postignut 70-ih godina i nakon više od 70 godina eksploatacije, životni vek kopova se bliži kraju. Ova lokacija je poznata i kao površinski kop Kišnjeva glava.

Veliki površinski kop predstavlja ožiljak na licu Fruške gore i definitivno nije dostojan nacionalnog parka. Decenije eksploatacije kamena ostavljaju pogubne posledice na prirodnu sredinu. Po novim nacionalnim zakonima i svetskim standardima, rudarski kopovi moraju biti zatvoreni kroz rekultivaciju terena i moraju biti uklopljeni u krajolik i ambijent nacionalnog parka. Ovaj proces tek treba da bude pokrenut.

Površinski kop se nalazi na oko dva kilometra od Partizanskog puta, a može se doći i iz smera Rakovca.

appMap.description_en: The lake, with its rich flora and fauna, with remarkable fish and birds will delight with its beauty every nature lover.
appMap.description_rs: Jezero raznovrsne flore i faune, sa kapitalnim primercima ribe i pticama kojima je ono prirodno stanište, očaraće svojom lepotom svakog ljubitelja prirode.
appMap.description_long_en: Kudoš lake is near Ruma, towards Fruška Gora, but it's more commonly known as Pavlovac Lake. It was formed by building a dam on the same-named stream for land irrigation purposes. It's about 75ha and six meters deep. Because of the rich flora this lake is teeming with fish, hence why there are a lot of sport fishermen throughout the year. The most prominent fish are: carp, catfish, perch, carp, tostolobik. The fishermen say that the fish are excellent. Many types of birds flock here, too. During summer days, the lake becomes a popular destination for all localmen, even those who live a bit further out and want to enjoy the smooth, glistening waters. Even with the first days of spring, the lake is visited by campers from all over the country in search of refuge in nature.
appMap.description_long_rs:
Nedaleko od Rume, u smeru ka Fruškoj gori, prostire se jezero Kudoš, poznatije kao Pavlovačko jezero. Nastalo je podizanjem brane na istoimenom potoku za potrebe navodnjavanja zemljišta. Površina mu je oko 75 hektara i dubina oko šest metara. Zbog raznovrsne flore ovo jezero je bogato ribom i zbog toga ga sportski ribolovci posećuju tokom cele godine. Od ribljih vrsta najzastupljeniji su šaran, som, smuđ, amur i tostolobik, a primerci su, po pričama ribolovaca, kapitalni. Mnogim vrstama ptica ovo jezero je postalo prirodno stanište. Leti postaje popularna destinacija za sve stanovnike lokalnih mesta, ali i za one koji žive malo dalje a žele da uživaju u čarima jezera. Već sa prvim prolećnim danima jezero posećuju i prvi kamperi iz svih krajeva zemlje u potrazi za odmorom u netaknutoj prirodi.

U blizini se još nalaze jezero i izletište Borkovac.

appMap.description_en: An abandoned micro village in the farmlands of Srem, about a kilometre away from Bingula, with its lively surroundings resembles an old, rich, Vojvodinian...
appMap.description_rs: Malo napušteno selo, smešteno u sremačkom ataru na oko kilometar od Stare Bingule, svojim živopisnim okruženjem podseća na deo stare ušorene vojvođanske ulice.
appMap.description_long_en:
Pištinci is a small abandoned village about one kilometre away from Stara Bingula. Many consider it a hamlet, and every person from the area will confirm that it used to be a village with about ten houses. It was inhabited during the seventies, and mail regularly arrived there. Over time, as people moved away from it, frantikly in search of a better life, it remained empty, forgotten.

There's only one old family living in Pištinci today, and one more person on the weekends. They now resemble a part of a common street in Vojvodina that was abandoned, picked up, and placed in a remote area in Srem, where it gives off the last signs of its life in this beautiful and hallowed region. You can get to Pištinci from Stara Bingula or by the acres of along the arable land that follows the channel Virevi between Bingula and Divoš.
appMap.description_long_rs:
Pištinci su malo napušteno selo koje se nalazi na jedan kilometar od Stare Bingule. Mnogi ga smatraju zaseokom, ali svaki meštanin obližnjih sela će vam potvrditi da je to nekad bilo selo sa oko deset kuća. Sedamdestih godina prošlog veka bilo je naseljeno i pošta je redovno stizala u ovo selo. S vremenom, kako su se ljudi odseljavali iz ovog  mesta mahom u potrazi za boljim životom, ono je ostalo prazno.

Danas u Pištincima živi samo jedna staračka porodica i jedan vikendaš. Pištinci sad podsećaju na deo vojvođanske ulice koji je odbačen i smešten u sremačkom ataru gde daje poslednje znake života u prelepom i živopisnom predelu. Do Pištinaca se može stići iz Stare Bingule ili atarom duž kanala Virevi između Bingule i Divoša.

appMap.description_en: Locals call it the best spring site around, and add: "She who gets drunk from the waters from Ćoravac, stays in Ljuba."
appMap.description_rs: Kako meštani tvrde, ovaj izvor je među najboljima u okolini, i dodaju: ‚‚Koja se devojka napije vode sa Ćoravca , ostaje u Ljubi”.
appMap.description_long_en: One of the best springs in Ljuba, as the locals call it. It's near the Belan fish pond, which you can reach by car to a point and then continue by foot. At the very spring site water accumulates in a concrete well, and ten meters further there's a hose which let's you get to the water more easily. The locals add: "She who gets drunk from the waters of Ćoravac, stays in Ljuba." Not far from here are the Jabuka and Martinov Do springs, and further on are other spring sites in Ljuba.
appMap.description_long_rs: Jedan od najboljih izvora u Ljubi, kako kažu meštani. Nalazi se blizu ribnjaka Belan do kog možete doći automobilom, a zatim nastaviti peške. Na samom izvorištu voda se akumulira u betonskom bazenčiću, a desetak metara niže sprovedeno je crevo kako bi se lakše došlo do vode. Meštani još kažu: „Koja se devojka napije vode sa Ćoravca, ostaje u Ljubi”. Nedaleko odavde je izvor Jabuka i Martinov Do, a dalje se nalaze i ostali ljubanski izvori.

appMap.description_en: A spring whose water flows freely from a concrete base. Located near the end of the Ljuba village, right bellow the bend on the left side of the plum orchard.
appMap.description_rs: Izvor čija voda teče u mlazu iz betonskog basena nalazi se na kraju sela Ljuba, odmah ispod okuke sa leve strane niz šljivik. Leti se dešava da izvor presuši.
appMap.description_long_en: At the end of the Ljuba village, right bellow the bend on the left side of the plum orchard, you can go down to the Orašje spring. Water flows freely from the concrete base, but during summer days it tends to dry out, so locals go to the nearby spring Cigljana instead.
appMap.description_long_rs: Pri kraju sela Ljuba, odmah ispod okuke sa leve strane niz šljivik, možete se spustiti do izvora Orašje. Iz betonskog basena voda teče u mlazu, ali tokom letnjih dana se dešava da presuši, tako da većina lokalnog stanovništva ide na obližnji izvor Cigljana.

appMap.description_en: The most used spring by the locals, because of its easy reach by car. Great for catching your breath and enjoying the scenery.
appMap.description_rs: Izvor koji najviše koriste meštani jer je najpristupačniji i do njega se može doći i kolima, mesto je gde možete predahnuti i uživati u čarima okolne doline.
appMap.description_long_en: The locals use the Cigljana spring because it's the most easiest to get to, and you can even drive up to it - one part of the road is dirt, but it's manageable. Follow the Vojvođanska street, then turn left to Janko Čmelik street, and then drop down "bellow." The spring is fenced so as to keep the sheep and other animals from drinking from it. Underneath the nearby willow tree you can catch your breath and enjoy the scenery.
appMap.description_long_rs: Meštani najviše koriste izvor Cigljana jer je najpristupačniji i do njega se može doći kolima – jedan deo puta je zemljani, ali prohodan. Pratite Vojvođansku ulicu pa skrenite levo u Janka Čmelika i spustite se u „dolju”. Izvor je ograđen da se ne bi ovce i ostale životinje napajale sa njega. Ispod obližnje vrbe možete da predahnete i uživate u dolini.

appMap.description_en: A spring site near the Belan tourism farms, situated deep within a forest; becomes a watering hole for animals when water overflows.
appMap.description_rs: Izvor u blizini turističkog gazdinstva Belan, smešten u šumskoj uvali, usled prelivanja vode stvara prirodna pojilišta za razne vrste divljači.
appMap.description_long_en: The spring is located near the Belan tourism farms. If you continue walking down the road that leads by a lake and don't happen to have a GPS devices, it's best if some of the locals give you directions or even take you there because the spring site is unmarked, and is deep within a forest. Many animals come to drink from the watering holes that are made when water overflows.
appMap.description_long_rs: Izvor se nalazi u blizini turističkog gazdinstva Belan. Ako nastavite peške putem koji vodi pored jezera a nemate GPS uređaj, najbolje je da vas neko od meštana odvede ili uputi jer je izvor neoznačen i nalazi se u šumskoj uvali. U produžetku uvale, od vode koja nadođe ili se prelije nastaju prirodna pojilišta, tako da tu dolazi divljač da se napaja vodom.

appMap.description_en: A resort in Vrdnik, also a viewpoint with one of the most beautiful views of Srem, regularly stops and enchants passers-by.
appMap.description_rs: Vrdničko izletište, ujedno i vidikovac sa kog se pruža jedan od najlepših pogleda na Srem, redovno zaustavlja ljude u prolazu i one koji su došli sa namerom da
appMap.description_long_en:
The many resorts of Fruška Gora are on its highest parts. From the first days of spring to the first days of cold, autumn, days, the resorts become the favourite spots for nature lovers. One of them is the Zmajevac resort, with one of the most beautiful views of Srem, especially in the evening hours, when the lights of the local villages are turned on. This resort is equipped with many wooden benches and tables, some of them are even covered with cloth, so they fit in perfectly into a scenic picnic area. There are outdoor grills and furnaces that make grilling easier. 

It's on the crossroad between the Partisan road and the Vrdnik-Rakovac road. Not far away are the Iriški Venac and Ledinci Lake, which you can reach by the forest road.
appMap.description_long_rs:
Na najvišim delovima Fruške gore nalaze se mnogobrojna izletišta koja s prvim danima proleća pa sve do početka hladnijih jesenjih dana postaju odredišta mnogih zaljubljenika u prirodu. Jedno od tih je i izletište Zmajevac, sa kog se pruža jedan od najlepših pogleda na Srem, posebno u večernjim satima kada počinju da se pale ulične svetiljke u obližnjim mestima. Ovo izletište je opremljeno mnogobrojnim drvenim klupama i stolovima, od kojih su neki natkriveni kao pravi letnjikovci i potpuno usklađeni s okruženjem. Postoje i ozidana ložišta koja olakšavaju pripremu roštilja.

Zmajevac se nalazi na raskršću Partizanskog puta i puta Vrdnik–Rakovac. Nedaleko su i Iriški venac i Ledinačko jezero do kojih se može stići šumskim putem.

appMap.description_en: A gem on Fruška Gora that enriched it from 1999. to 2009. The lake has since been drained and is waiting for an ore quarry.
appMap.description_rs: Dragulj Fruške gore koji ju je krasio od 1999. do 2009. Jezero je sad ispražnjeno i čeka na eksploataciju rude.
appMap.description_long_en:
Another one of Fruška Gora's gems, the lake was made in 1999. when the pumps from the Srebro quarry stopped working. The place was mined for rare volcanic ore "trahit" used in asphalt mixtures and high quality concrete. The lake was filled by groundwater as well as Lukin svetac and Srebrni potok streams. The water grew over time so that at one point the lake was 50 meters deep. Steep ledges, rich forests and the cut-off streams that gave shape to the falls made this lake truly magical.  - it was the heart of Fruška Gora. The water was rich with minerals and because of its thickness, swimming in it feels like swimming in the sea. The lake revived Ledinci as a reward for all the inconveniences the locals had to endure during the mining. 

Since 2005. the lake and land went to be owned by a Rakovac company named Alas. The residents of Ledinci and environment organisations, as well as fans of the lake, led an unsuccessful battle to keep the lake and its surroundings intact. The lake was emptied in summer, 2009, and after the ore mining (that should've lasted for five years) a re-cultivation of land was planned, which will presumably turn the quarry into a "beautiful park of nature."

The lake remains empty, and was used as a film location for Čarlston za Ognjenku, Mi Nismo Anđeli 3, as well as a video for Zdravko Čolić's song Ao nono bijela. 

If you passed by the Zvečan spring, you're on the right road to a viewpoint from which you can see the lake. Follow the forest roads because the main one is owned by the quarry company, so access is not allowed. The viewpoint is not the safest one out there, so be careful.
appMap.description_long_rs:
Još jedan dragulj Fruške gore koji je nastao 1999. godine prestankom rada pumpi kamenoloma Srebro. Na tom mestu se eksploatisala retka ruda vulkanskog porekla trahit koja služi za asfaltne mešavine i betone visokog kvaliteta. Jezero se punilo podzemnim vodama, kao i potocima Lukin svetac i Srebrni potok. Voda je s vremenom rasla tako da je u nekom trenutku dubina jezera iznosila oko 50 metara. Strme litice, bogate fruškogorske šume i presečeni potoci koji su obrazovali slapove činili su ovo jezero čarobnim – bila je to zenica Fruške gore. Voda je bila bogata mineralima i zbog svoje gustine osećaj plivanja je bio kao u moru. Jezero je oživelo Ledince kao nagrada za sve nelagodnosti koje su meštani trpeli tokom rada kamenoloma.

Od 2005. godine jezero i zemlja su prešli u vlasništvo rakovačke kompanije „Alas”. Ledinčani i ekološke organizacije, kao i ljubiteji ovog jezera, bezuspešno su vodili borbu da jezero i okolina ostanu netaknuti. Jezero je ispražnjeno u leto 2009, a nakon eksploatacije rude (koja bi trebalo da traje pet godina), planirana je rekultivacija zemljišta koja će navodno preobraziti kamenolom u „velelepni park priode”.

Jezero je ostalo poznato i po tome što su na tom mestu snimani filmovi „Čarlston za Ognjenku”, „Mi nismo anđeli 3”, kao i spot Zdravka Čolića „Ao nono bijela”.

Ako ste prošli izvor Zvečan, na pravom ste putu do vidikovca sa koga možete videti jezero. Pratite šumske puteve jer je glavni put u vlasništvu kamenoloma, tako da nije dozvoljen pristup. Vidikovac nije najbezbedniji, stoga obratite pažnju.

appMap.description_en: A lake near Ruma, on the southern slopes of Fruška Gora, an ideal destination for all lovers of nature and sport fishing, adorned by the ecological Aqua Camp.
appMap.description_rs: Jezero u blizini Rume, na južnim padinama Fruške gore, idealna je destinacija za sve ljubitelje ribolova i prirode jer ga krasi ekološki ‚‚Akva-kamp”.
appMap.description_long_en:
The Borkovac lake is at the southern slopes of Fruška Gora, a few kilometres away from Ruma. The lake is 42 acres big, and five meters deep. This accumulation of water happened during the seventies when the damn on the Borkovac stream was built. After the initial purpose for irrigation purposes, this is a hallmark tourist destination for nature lovers and fishing.  It's rich with different sorts of fish, so there's a fishing competition organised every year at the beginning of May. The lake has a beach with showers, so during hot days it becomes a great place to relax. 

This lake is adored by the ecological "Aqua camp," which is made up of four houses on barges. Each house has a few beds, two wide terraces decorated with flowers, and a boat for taking guests to the beach. This accommodation is a great choice for sport fishermen and all those looking for a fulfilling and unique experience. 

The Borkovac resort is right next to the lake, and the Pavlovac lake is just five kilometres away.
appMap.description_long_rs:
Borkovačko jezero leži na južnim padinama Fruške gore i udaljeno je samo nekoliko kilometara od centra Rume. Jezero se prostire na površini od 42 hektara a maksimalna dubina je pet metara. Ova akumulacija nastala je 70-ih godina izgradnjom brane na potoku Borkovac. Pored prvobitne namene za navodnjavanje zemljišta, ovo je danas značajna turistička destinacija za sve ljubitelje prirode i ribolova. Izuzetno je bogato raznim vrstama riba, pa se svake godine početkom maja organizuje takmičenje u ribolovu. Jezero ima uređenu plažu sa tuševima i pratećim sadržajem, pa u vrelim letnjim danima postaje pravo mesto za odmor i rekreaciju.

Ovo jezero još krasi i ekološki „Akva-kamp”, koji čine četiri kućice smeštene na baržama. Svaka kućica ima nekoliko ležaja, dve prostrane terase ukrašene cvećem i poseduje svoj čamac kojim se gosti prevoze do obale. Ovakav smeštaj je pravi izbor za sportske ribolovce i sve one koji traže jedinstven i potpun doživljaj.

Tik uz jezero se nalazi Borkovačko izletište a na samo pet kilometara udaljenosti i Pavlovačko jezero.

appMap.description_en: A resort near the Borkovac lake, with luscious vegetation, a stream, a park, and a trim-track with wooden exercise equipment, is an ideal place to relax.
appMap.description_rs: Izletište tik uz Borkovačko jezero, bujne vegetacije, sa potokom i parkom sa trim-stazom i drvenim spravama za vežbanje, idealno je mesto za odmor i rekreaciju.
appMap.description_long_en: The Borkovac resort represents an ideal place to relax and for recreation to the locals, especially the folks from Ruma. Because of its large area and vegetation, this getaway place can be freely called the heart of the region. There are several restaurants, cafes, as well as a hotel surrounded by a pine forest. You can enjoy a lovely walk in the park by the stream, or you can run at the trim track, next to which are the strikingly coloured wooden exercise equipment. The resort is especially popular during events such as dog shows, art colonies, and most of all during 1. May. It's a few kilometres away from Ruma, right next to the Borkovac Lake.
appMap.description_long_rs:
Izletište Borkovac predstavlja idealno mesto za odmor i rekreaciju stanovnicima iz okolnih mesta, naročito Rume. Zbog površine na kojoj se prostire i svoje bujne vegetacije, ovo izletište možemo slobodno nazvati i plućima regije u kojoj se nalazi. U ovom izletištu postoji nekoliko restorana, kafića, kao i hotel koji je okružen borovom šumom. U parku možete uživati u šetnji pokraj potoka ili trčanjem na trim-stazi uz koju su napravljene drvene sprave za vežbanje veselog kolorita. Na izletištu je započeta i gradnja zatvorenog i otvorenog olimpijskog bazena. Izletište je posebno posećeno za vreme događaja kao što su izložbe pasa, slikarske kolonije, a najviše za prvomajski uranak. Nalazi se na samo nekoliko kilometara od Rume, tik uz Borkovačko jezero.

U blizini se nalazi i jezero Pavlovci, a nešto malo dalje i manastiri Novo i Staro Hopovo. Od auto-puta Beograd–Zagreb je udaljeno samo 10 kilometara i zbog toga ovo izletište ima potencijal da postane prava turistička atrakcija.

appMap.description_en: The lake near the Mađelos village is an ideal location for those who love sports fishing, and it's near the Vranjaš spring, and the Sveti Vasilije Ostroški...
appMap.description_rs: Jezero nedaleko od sela Manđelos predstavlja idealnu lokaciju za ljubitelje sportskog ribolova, a u blizini su izvor Vranjaš i manastir Sveti Vasilije Ostroški.
appMap.description_long_en: Vranjaš lake is located near the Manđelos village. Originally made as a reservoir for irrigating the surrounding fields and orchards, now it's mostly enjoyed by fishermen. As far as fish goes, it's teeming mostly with babushkas, carp, grass carp and silver carp. You can see folks around the lake looking for Roman and Austro-Hungarian coins and other antiquities. About 3km from taking the turn for the lake, is the famous spring Vranjaš, and the St. Vasilije Ostroški monastery that's been raised above the spring.
appMap.description_long_rs: Jezero Vranjaš se nalazi u blizini sela Manđelos. Prvobitno napravljeno kao akumulaciono jezero za navodnjavanje okolnih njiva i voćnjaka, da bi sad u njemu najviše uživali ribolovci. Od ribe uglavnom ima babuške, šarana, amura i tostolobika. Oko jezera se vrlo često mogu videti tragači za rimskim i austrougarskim novčićima i ostalim antikvitetima. Na oko tri kilometra od skretanja za jezero nalaze se i čuveni izvor Vranjaš i manastir Sveti Vasilije Ostroški, koji je podignut iznad izvora.

appMap.description_en: A spring, walled and built by local hunters in 1986. It's located deep inside a forest, near the Belan tourism farms.
appMap.description_rs: Izvor, koji su ozidali lokalni lovci 1968. godine, smešten je u šumskoj uvali u blizini turističkog gazdinstva Belan.
appMap.description_long_en: The spring is located near the Belan tourism farms. If you continue walking down the road that goes by the lake and don't happen to have a GPS device, it's best if some of the locals show you the way, or even take you there themselves, because the spring site is not marked, and it's deep within a forest. The spring was walled and enclosed by local hunters in 1986. They left their mark on the concrete. You can also continue on to Čalambir spring, which is even deeper in the forest.
appMap.description_long_rs: Izvor se nalazi u blizini turističkog gazdinstva Belan. Ako nastavite peške putem koji vodi pored jezera a nemate GPS uređaj, najbolje je da vas neko od meštana odvede ili uputi jer je izvor neoznačen i nalazi se u šumskoj uvali. Izvor su ozidali lokalni lovci 1968. godine koji su ostavili trag na betonu. U nastavku možete otići i do izvora Čalambira, koji je još dublje u šumi.

appMap.description_en: A cave made by quarrying stone, has a 4m high main hall, and a road inside that leads above the hall's vault, where there's a striking view of Fruška Gora
appMap.description_rs: Pećina, nastala iskopavanjem kamena, ima dvoranu visoku 4 m, a unutra postoji put koji vodi iznad svoda dvorane, odakle se pruža upečatljiv pogled na Fruškogorj
appMap.description_long_en: The old Beli Majdan quarry, also known as the Rakovačka Pećina, is in Rakovac. You can get to the cave by car via the road or by foot from the National Liberation War monument that's next to the main road to Zmajevac. Prepare yourself for a little climb up a steep slope, after which you'll arrive to the great hall. The hall is 4m high, and was made by digging out stones in the eary ages, most probably to be used for the Rakovac monastery nearby. Stone pillars hold the vault. The mine was closed during the thirties. There are steps clad in stone, so you can explore the inner chambers. The entire complex is gargantuan and unique to Fruška Gora. There's a road that can lead you above the hall's vault where you'll find a striking view of the Fruška Gora. There's also a hole in the ground near the cave, from which warm air comes out - it's especially noticable during cold days. One might say it's a rabbit's hole, but don't go chasing any rabbits down it, if you see them. Chances are you'll end up in Wonderland.
appMap.description_long_rs:
Stari kamenolom Beli Majdan, ili kako ga još zovu Rakovačka pećina, nalazi se u Rakovcu. Do pećine se može doći direktno automobilom nasutim putem ili peške od spomenika posvećenog NOB-u koji se nalazi pored glavnog puta koji vodi za Zmajevac. Pripremite se za malo penjanja uz strmu padinu kako biste došli do velike dvorane.

Dvorana je visoka oko četiri metra, nastala je iskopavanjem kamena u davnim vremenima najverovatnije za potrebe obližnjeg manastira Rakovac, a svod drže kameni stubovi. Rudnički kop je zatvoren 30-ih godina. Postoje i stepenice isklesane u kamenu, tako da možete obići sve odaje u unutrašnjosti. Dimenzije celog kompleksa su impozantne i jedinstvene za područje Fruške gore. Postoji put koji vas može dovesti iznad svoda dvorane odakle se pruža upečatljiv pogled na Fruškogorje. Pored pećine se nalazi i jedan otvor u zemlji iz koga izbija topao vazduh koji je posebno osetan tokom hladnijih dana.

appMap.description_en: This spring is right next to the memorial park dedicated to the National Liberation War. The locals say it's not safe for drinking.
appMap.description_rs: Izvor je smešten pored spomen-parka posvećenog NOB-u nedaleko od šumskog puta za Beli Majdan. Meštani tvrde da voda s izvorišta nije dobra za piće.
appMap.description_long_en: This spring is right next to the memorial park dedicated to the National Liberation War, which is near the forest road to Beli Majdan. Even though it's accessible and enclosed this water is not suitable for drinking, as said by the locals. You'll have to quench your thirst some place else.
appMap.description_long_rs: Ovaj izvor se nalazi odmah pored spomen-parka posvećenog NOB-u a nedaleko od šumskog puta za Beli Majdan. Iako je ograđena i pristupačna, meštani kažu da ova voda nije za piće, tako da ćete žeđ morati da ugasite na nekom drugom rakovačkom izvoru.

appMap.description_en: The spring is mentioned in II century b.c. as an aqueduct that supplied water to ancient Sirmium, and above it is a church and monastery.
appMap.description_rs: Izvor se pominje u II veku p. n. e. kao akvadukt koji je vodom snadbevao drevni Sirmium, a iznad se nalazi crkva manastira posvećenog Svetom Vasiliju Ostroškom.
appMap.description_long_en: The Vranjaš spring is mentioned as early as the second century b.c. The water (aqueduct) was supplied to Sremska Mitrovica, or then known as Sirmium, as one of the four capitals of the Roman Empire. The spring was a place of gathering of religious believers throughout history. It's dedicated to saints Kuzma and Damjan, which is undoubtedly shown by the mosaics above the water. There's a church above it, and it's part of the youngest monastery on Fruška Gora that's dedicated to Sveti Vasilije Ostroški. During the harshest droughts the water flows unrelentingly, cool and refreshing. Around the monastery and spring is a picnic area with a thick shade where you can take a break in a serene and calm atmosphere with the sounds of water flowing nearby. the spring is located on the Manđelos-Grgurevci road.
appMap.description_long_rs: Izvor Vranjaš se pominje još u II veku pre nove ere. Vodom (akvadukt) je snabdevao Sremsku Mitrovicu, odnosno tadašnji Sirmijum, jednu od četiri prestonice Rimskog carstva. Izvor je tokom svoje istorije bio mesto okupljanja vernika. Posvećen je Svetom Kozmi i Damjanu (Kuzma i Damjan), što nesumnjivo pokazuju i mozaici iznad vode. Iznad izvora izgrađena je crkva koja je deo najmlađeg fruškogorskog manastira koji je posvećen Svetom Vasiliju Ostroškom. I u najvećim sušama voda izlazi punim intenzitetom, hladna i okrepljujuća. Oko samog manastira, odnosno izvora je izletište i dubok hlad gde možete predahnuti uz prijatnu atmosferu i žubor vode. Izvor se nalazi na putu Manđelos–Grgurevci.

appMap.description_en: The first in a line of springs at this site that counts seven springs in total, is near the tourist estate Belan, snugged in a small cove.
appMap.description_rs: Prvi u nizu izvora na ovom lokalitetu koji broji njih oko sedam. Izvor se nalazi u blizini turističkog gazdinstva Belan ušuškan u maloj uvali.
appMap.description_long_en: This is the first in line of springs at this site which counts seven springs in total. The spring is located near the Belan tourist estate, snugged cozily in a small cove. While you're there, you can visit the other springs by taking a light walk. Almost all springs are fenced, and the water accumulates in pools, so there's no stream.
appMap.description_long_rs: Prvi u nizu izvora na ovom lokalitetu koji broji njih oko sedam. Izvor se nalazi u blizini turističkog gazdinstva Belan ušuškan u maloj uvali. Kada ste već tu, laganom šetnjom možete obići i ostale ljubanske izvore. Gotovo svi izvori u Ljubi su ograđeni, a voda se akumulira u bazenima, tako da ne postoji tok.

appMap.description_en: A spring of drinkable water Sveti Nikola and a fountain built by a local man from Neradin called Sava, is at the Irig-Krušedol road near the turn for Neradin.
appMap.description_rs: Izvor pitke vode Sveti Nikola i česma koju je izgradio Neradinac Sava, po čijem imenu se i zove, nalazi se na putu Irig–Krušedol u blizini skretanja za Neradin.
appMap.description_long_en:
On the way to Irig-Krušedol, after a few kilomtres near the turn for Neradin, is a spring of drinkable water known as Sveti Nikola spring. This fountain was built by Sava, a local man from Neradin, so that's why they also call it "Savina česma" (Sava's fountain). At any time of day you can find people waiting in line to fill their barrels with water. The area around is paved, and there's a table with a few benches for all passing travelers. 

There's also the Međeš (Šatrinačko) lake nearby, and a little bit further is the Dobrodol lake.
appMap.description_long_rs:
Na putu Irig–Krušedol, posle nekoliko kilometara u blizini skretanja za Neradin, nalazi se izvor pitke vode poznatiji kao izvor Sveti Nikola. Ovu česmu je izgradio jedan Neradinac po imenu Sava, i stoga je još nazivaju i „Savina česma”. Ovde ćete, u bilo koje doba dana, zateći ljude koji čekaju u redu kako bi napunili balone sa vodom. Prostor oko nje je popločan i na njemu je postavljen sto sa klupama za sve putnike namernike.

Na samo nekoliko kilometara od izvora nalazi se jezero Međeš (Šatrinačko), a nešto malo dalje i jezero Dobrodol.

appMap.description_en: The lake is in private property of MK Komerc, but was turned into a private nature reserve, for fishing, sports, recreation, and is near the Maradik village.
appMap.description_rs: Jezero u vlasništvu firme MK Komerc uređeno kao privatni rezervat prirode, služi za sportski ribolov, sport i rekreaciju, a nalazi se u blizini sela Maradik.
appMap.description_long_en:
Between Irig and Inđija, a few kilometers from the Maradik village is the Šelevrenac lake. It was formed during the eighties when a dam was built on the stream that bears the same name. It's one of the biggest lakes on Fruška Gora with a spread of 65ha, and the only one bigger than it is the Moharač lake with 70ha.

The firm MK Komerc bought an agricultural conglomerate which also encompasses the extention, cleaned it up, built a fence, and arranged it as a private natural reserve. It's for sport fishing (with a paid license), relaxation and recreation. Swimming is not allowed. 

A few kilometres away are the lakes Dobrodol, Jarkovci, and Pavlovci, where you can freely spread a towel, lie down, and enjoy the summer days.
appMap.description_long_rs:
Između iriške i inđijske opštine, na svega nekoliko kilometara od sela Maradik, nalazi se jezero Šelevrenac, nastalo 80-ih godina izgradnjom brane na istoimenom potoku.To je jedno od najvećih jezera Fruške gore sa površinom od 65 hektara, veće od njega je jedino Moharač sa površinom od oko 70 hektara.

Firma MK „Komerc” je 2008. kupila poljoprivredni kombinat u čijem je vlasništvu i jezero, pa ga je ogradila i uredila kao privatni rezervat prirode. Služi za sportski ribolov (uz plaćenu dozvolu), odmor i rekreaciju. Kupanje nije dozvoljeno.

Na svega nekoliko kilometara se nalaze jezera Dobrodol, Jarkovci i Pavlovci, gde možete slobodno da prostrete peškir i uživate tokom letnjih dana.

appMap.description_en: A hotel not far from Ležimir, a place where people enjoyed serene nature, was left to ruin during the nineties and is now used by fans of paintball.
appMap.description_rs: Hotel nedaleko od Ležimira, mesta gde su ljudi uživali u lepoj prirodi, ruiniran je tokom 90-ih godina i sada ga koriste ljubitelji pejntbola kao poligon.
appMap.description_long_en:
Not far from the Ležimir village at the outskirts of Fruška Gora is the former, and you won't believe the name, Fruška Gora Hotel. During the seventies and eighties people came and enjoyed the nature and plenty activities at the hotel. Visitors from Belgrade and Novi Sad came in troves, to at least taste the famous cuisine here. During the wars that happened hence forth, many refugees made the hotel their home, and took care of it. After the refugees left and subsequent failed sales of the hotel, it was demolished, robbed, and left to ruin. What remains today are the colourful walls that serve as a hallowed reminder of a place very much alive and beautiful. 

The hotel ruins eventually found a partial use - fans of extreme sports use it as a polygon to play paintball.
appMap.description_long_rs:
Nedaleko od sela Ležimir na obroncima Fruške gore nalazi se nekadašnji hotel Fruška gora. Sedamdesetih i osamdesetih godina su ovde ljudi uživali u prirodi i bogatoj ponudi hotela. Posetioci mahom iz Beograda i Novog Sada dolazili su da probaju čuvene kulinarske specijalitete. U hotel su se tokom ratova koji su se desili na ovim prostorima doselile izbeglice, koje su tu boravile i brinule se o njemu. Nakon njihovog odlaska i neuspešnih privatizacija, ovaj hotel je demoliran i opljačkan. Danas pažnju privlače samo koloritni zidovi kao podsetnik da je ovaj hotel nekada vrveo od života.

Hotel kao takav je našao delimičnu primenu, te ga ljubitelji ekstremnog sporta koriste kao poligon za igranje pejntbola.

appMap.description_en: The biggest tower on Fruška Gora is an indispensable part of the Novi Sad panorama, and is also home to the most remarkable view of Novi Sad, Srem, Bačka.
appMap.description_rs: Najveći toranj na Fruškoj gori, visine 170 m, neizostavni je deo panorame Novog Sada, dok se s ovog mesta pruža prelep pogled na Srem i Bačku.
appMap.description_long_en:
The TV tower on Iriški Venac is the biggest one on Fruška Gora with its 170m in height. The armored concrete construction was built in 1975. and its main purpose was the emission of radio and TV signals in Vojvodina. Because of is location and height, the object is visible from the most part of the Srem and Bačka side, and is an indispensable part of the Novi Sad panorama. It suffered great amounts of damage during the NATO  bombing in 1999. and has since been in limited function. The sanitation plan still hasn't been clearly defined. The tower has huge tuourism potential, especially by restoring the observation deck that has a venerable view of Novi Sad, Srem, and Bačka. 

It's near the most important crossroad on Fruška Gora, at the top of the Iriški Venac. In its vicinity are the National Liberation Fight monument Sloboda.
appMap.description_long_rs:
Repetitor Iriški venac je najveći TV toranj na Fruškoj gori, visok 170 metara. Konstrukcija od armiranog betona je sagrađena 1975. godine i osnovna namena mu je bila emisija radio i TV signala na teritoriji Vojvodine. Zbog svog položaja i visine, objekat je vidljiv sa većeg dela sremske i bačke strane, a i neizostavni je deo panorame Novog Sada. Pretrpeo je veliko oštećenje tokom NATO bombardovanja 1999. godine i od tada je u privremenoj funkciji, a sanacija i dalje nije jasno definisana. Sam toranj ima veliki turistički potencijal, pogotovo u slučaju osposobljavanja opservacionog deka s upečatljivim pogledom na Novi Sad, Srem i Bačku.

Nalazi se u blizini najvažnije raskrsnice na Fruškoj gori, na vrhu Iriškog venca. U neposrednoj blizini se nalazi monumentalni spomenik NOB-a Sloboda.

appMap.description_en: The monument site with a high obelisk and a woman on top representing liberty by author Sreten Stojanović, was rasied in honor of the fallen soldiers during...
appMap.description_rs: Spomenik sa visokim obeliskom i predstavom žene kao oličenjem slobode, autora Sretena Stojanovića, podignut je u čast palim borcima NOB-a u II svetskom ratu.
appMap.description_long_en:
Sloboda (Freedom) is the name of the monument on Iriški venac. It was raised in honor of the fallen soldiers and represents a symbol of the National Liberation struggle against fascism in the second world war. It was revealed in 1951. and the sculptor was Sreten Stojanović. The monument is dominated by a high obelisk, which at its top holds the figure of a woman - the personification of liberty - with her arms held high as gesture that calls for an uprising. Standing ont he pedestal of the obelisk is a group of armed partisans. At its flanks are the bronze reliefs depicting the suffering, resistance, and fight. The obelisk and the accompaniying walls were built from limestone rock that was dug up on Fruška Gora. 

This also happens to be the biggest monument on Fruška Gora, and the location was purposefully selected so that the obelisk, a symbol of liberty and resistance, could be seen from the driveway to Iriški Venac. 

There's a conifer park near the complex. The foot path around are also interesting and educational because they're littered with info signboards geared towards kids, so that they may learn more about the plant and animal life of Fruška Gora.
appMap.description_long_rs:
Sloboda je naziv spomenika na Iriškom vencu. Podignut je u čast palih boraca i predstavlja simbol Narodnooslobodilčke borbe protiv fašizma u Drugom svetskom ratu. Otkriven je 1951. godine, a autor je skulptor Sreten Stojanović. Spomenikom dominira visoki obelisk na čijem se vrhu nalazi predstava žene – oličenje slobode – sa visoko podignutim rukama kao gest kojim se poziva na ustanak. Na postolju iz koga se uzdiže obelisk nalazi se grupa naoružanih partizana. Na bočnim stranama spomenika nalaze se bronzani reljefi sa prikazima stradanja, otpora i borbe. Obelisk i prateći zidovi su izgrađeni od krečnjačkog kamena sa Fruške gore.

Najveći je spomenik na Fruškoj gori, a lokacija je sa razlogom odabrana kako bi se obelisk, simbol slobode i otpora, mogao videti sa prilaza Iriškom vencu.

Pokraj kompleksa se nalazi park sa četinarima. Interesantne su i edukativne pešačke rute sa raspoređenim informacionim tablama namenjene najmlađima s ciljem da upoznaju biljni i životinjski svet Fruške gore.

appMap.description_en: A great meadow and wide pass in this picnic area let you find your own spot for fun. There are forest roads nearby that lead to Beočin monastery and...
appMap.description_rs: Velika livada i širok pojas ovog izletišta omogućavaju vam da nađete kutak za zabavu. U blizini su šumski putevi do Beočinskog manastira i Dumbovačkih vodopada.
appMap.description_long_en:
At the Partisan road between Crveni Čot and Vrdnik, there's the Brankovac resort, from which spans a wonderfull view of Novi Sad. There used to be resort from the National Postal Service that was in full swing, but it has since been abandoned, and there only thing left working seems to be the antennas and the repetitors that surround the area. 

The resort is out of function, but this doesn't lesson the popularity of this place that regularly lures visitors during the weekends.
