Nedaleko u šumi sa leve strane se nalaze hranilice za divljač, a ako nastavite ravno, možete doći do sledeće čeke koja se nalazi sa leve strane u uvali kod šume. Na samom početku je  hranilica kraj potoka koji obrazuju dva izvora sa kog se napaja divljač, a ako budete dobre sreće, možete naleteti na nekog srndaća. Veliki broj okolnih izvora čini da ovaj predeo u periodima najvećih suša ima svežu travu i samim tim i mnogo divljači.

appMap.description_en: Deep in the cool shade of Fruška Gora's forest, about 2km from Banja, the Sveti Đorđe spring offers respite to locals and travelers alike.
appMap.description_rs: Smešten u dubokom hladu fruškogorske šume, na oko 2 km od Banje, izvor Sveti Đorđe pruža osveženje meštanima i putnicima namernicima.
appMap.description_long_en: About 2km from the entrance to Banja, there's a spring dedicated to Saint Đorđe in the very spring. A bit abandoned, deep in the shade of Fruška Gora, it offers respite to locals and travelers alike. The water from the spring fills a basin so there's water even during the greatest droughts. The rest of the water overflows into a small stream that nourishes the wildlife.
appMap.description_long_rs: Na oko dva kilometra od ulaza u Banju, u samoj šumi, nalazi se izvor koji je posvećen Svetom Đorđu. Pomalo zapušten, u dubokoj hladovini Fruške gore, pruža osveženje meštanima i putnicima namernicima. Voda iz izvorišta puni basen, tako da i u vreme najvećih suša u njemu ima vode. Ostatak koji se preliva obrazuje potočić sa kog se napaja divljač.

appMap.description_en: If you venture across Kosača meadow you'll end up at the spring Tri oraja. The name comes from the local nickname "oraj", and means three walnut trees.
appMap.description_rs: Ako se uputite preko livade Kosača, naići ćete na izvor Tri oraja. Naziv potiče od lokalizma „oraj”, i opisuje tri velika crna oraha pod kojima se nalazi izvor
appMap.description_long_en: About 1,3km from Banja, across the Kosača meadow and next to the road is the spring Tri oraja. The name describes this source as one between three big black walnut trees (Juglans Nigra). There's a spring in the forest not far from there, called Sveti Đorđe.
appMap.description_long_rs: Na oko 1,3 kilometra od Banje, preko livade Kosača i pored samog puta, nalazi se izvor Tri oraja. Samo ime opisuje ovaj izvor jer se nalazi između tri velika crna oraha (Juglans nigra). Nedaleko odatle – u šumi – nalazi se izvor Sveti Đorđe.

appMap.description_en: A picnic area, set on a slightly wavy plateau, is by the Partizanski road, between Letenka and Crveni Čot. There's the same-named spring nearby.
appMap.description_rs: Izletište, smešteno na blago talasastoj zaravni, nalazi se uz Partizanski put, između Letenke i Crvenog čota. U blizini je istoimeni izvor.
appMap.description_long_en:
Jabuka picnic area is by the Partisan road, between Letenka and Crveni čot, labeled by a wooden sign. The area is on a slightly wavy plateau with sparse but spacious treetops. 

At the central place there's a monument and a great stone dedicated to the forming of the 8th Vojvodina brigade in 1941. The area is littered with randomly placed benches and chairs. If you go down the gravel road you'll end up at the same-named spring.
appMap.description_long_rs:
Izletište Jabuka se nalazi uz Partizanski put, između Letenke i Crvenog čota, označeno drvenom tablom sa natpisom. Izletište je postavljeno na blago talasastoj zaravni sa proređenim, ali prostranim krošnjama.

Na centralnom mestu se nalazi spomen-obeležje i veliki kamen koji je posvećen formiranju 8. Vojvođanske udarne brigade 1941. godine. Izletište je prošarano nasumično postavljenim drvenih stolovima i klupama. Ako se spustite makadamskim putem, možete doći do izvora.

appMap.description_en: A gravel road from Jabuka picnic area leads to the same-named spring, surrounded by a monument with a staircase leading to the spring source.
appMap.description_rs: Makadamski put od izletišta Jabuka vodi do istoimenog izvora, koji se odlikuje monumentalnim obeležjem sa stepeništem koje vodi do samog izvorišta.
appMap.description_long_en: If you follow the gravel rode from the Jabuka picnic area, you'll arrive at a spring around which there's a monument, slightly burried in the earth with a staircase that leads to the spring itself. The locals say that the water from this spring is the best in the area.
appMap.description_long_rs: Ukoliko pratite makadamski putić s izletišta Jabuka, doći ćete do izvora oko koga je izgrađeno monumentalno obeležje, blago ukopano u zemlju sa stepeništem koje vodi do samog izvorišta. Okolni meštani kažu za vodu s ovog izvora da je najbolja u okolini.

appMap.description_en: Kraljevac can be found to the right of the Kraljev Izvor Picnic Area, down the timber stairs.
appMap.description_rs: Kraljevac se nalazi na izletištu Kraljev izvor, a do njega se dolazi šumskim stepenicama desno od izletišta.
appMap.description_long_en: Kraljevac is a spring near Crveni Čot, and it is located to the right of the Kraljev Izvor Picnic Area, down the timber stairs. The original spring is not in function, and the water does not flow from the pipe but from the ground nearby, at the improvised source.
appMap.description_long_rs: Kraljevac je izvor koji se nalazi blizu Crvenog čota, odnosno desno od izletišta Kraljev izvor niz šumske stepenice. Prvobitni izvor nije u funkciji i voda ne curi kroz cev, nego izbija iz zemlje odmah pored na impovizovanom izvorištu.

appMap.description_en: A small picnic area near Crveni Čot, including Kraljevac Spring, that is ideal for a short break, because it is right next to Partisan road.
appMap.description_rs: Malo izletište u blizini Crvenog čota, s izvorom Kraljevac, idealno je mesto za kratkotrajni odmor i predah jer se nalazi kraj Partizanskog puta.
appMap.description_long_en:
This small picnic area near Crveni Čot is somewhat in the shadows of the other two picnic areas in the vicinity: Letenka and Jabuka.

Camping and building a fire is prohibitet, but it is an ideal location for a short break because it is right next to Partisan road, and Kraljevac Spring is nearby, so you can freshen up. The place is not well marked, and you can easily miss it if you travel by car, so look out for the only sign by the road that points to it, a yellow arrow saying "Izvor".
appMap.description_long_rs:
Ovo malo izletište blizu Crvenog čota je nekako u senci dva obližnja izletišta Letenke i Jabuke.

Na ovom mestu se ne može kampovati i ložiti vatra, ali je zato idealno za kratkotrajni odmor i predah, jer se nalazi kraj Partizanskog puta, a tu je i izvor vode Kraljevac na kome se možete osvežiti. Mesto nije najbolje označeno i, ukoliko putujete kolima, vrlo lako ga možete promašiti, stoga obratite pažnju jer jedina oznaka kraj puta je žuta strelica na kojoj piše „Izvor”.

appMap.description_en: Located in the central part of Fruška Gora is one of the largest, most popular picnic areas. Letenka is the perfect destination for fresh air and some exercise.
appMap.description_rs: Smeštena u središnjem delu Fruškogorja i jedno od najpoznatijih i najvećih izletišta, Letenka je mesto za sve ljubitelje čistog planinskog vazduha i rekreacije.
appMap.description_long_en: Located in the central part of Fruška Gora, and one of the largest and most popular picnic areas. Letenka is the perfect destination for anyone wishing to take in some fresh air and exercise.
appMap.description_long_rs: Smešteno u središnjem delu Fruškogorja i jedno od najpoznatijih i najvećih izletišta, Letenka je mesto za sve ljubitelje čistog planinskog vazduha i rekreacije.

appMap.description_en: The dreamlike scenery of a forest path enclosed with a wooden fence will charm you as you reach this spring, situated in the vicinity of Papratski Do.
appMap.description_rs: Bajkovita slika putića sa drvenom ogradom koji vodi do lepo uređenog izvora očaraće vas ako se uputite ka ovoj lokaciji, smeštenoj u blizini Papratskog Dola.
appMap.description_long_en:
Sveti Đurđe Spring and fountain were established at the end of the 19th century, and renovated and reconstructed in 2012.

Since it is in a small valley by the road, it is barely noticeable and rarely visited. If you take Partisan road from Grgurevci, you will find a path across the street from a sign saying "Papratski Do", leading into the forest. Follow this path to reach the spring, and enjoy the dreamlike scenery of the path and wooden fence leading downhill to the neat little water source.
appMap.description_long_rs:
Izvor Svetog Đurđa sa česmom podignut je krajem XIX veka, a obnovljen i rekonstruisan 2012. godine.

Pošto se nalazi u maloj udolini pokraj puta, teško je uočljiv i zbog toga ne tako često posećivan. Ako idete Partizanskim putem iz pravca Grgurevaca, preko puta table sa natpisom Papratski Do nalazi se putić koji vodi u šumu i dalje prema izvoru. Očaraće vas bajkovita slika putića sa drvenom ogradom koji nizbrdo vodi do lepo uređenog izvora.

appMap.description_en: A picnic area with an ethno house, Vojvodinian cottage and fenced yard, just before the turn to the village of Grgurevci.
appMap.description_rs: Izletište u okviru kog je izgrađena etno-kuća sa dvorištem, čiji ambijent upotpunjuje i vojvođanski čardak, nalazi se neposredno pre skretanja za Grgurevce.
appMap.description_long_en:
The Popov Čot Picnic Area lies near Partisan road, just before the turn for Grgurevci, and its location is marked on a wooden notice board.

A mountain ethno house with a fenced yard was built here recently, and the atmosphere is complemented with a Vojvodinian cottage near the house. Tables and benches are scattered around the yard for your relaxation, and there is also a children's corner. Behind the fenced yard, to the west, lies the peak and plateau known as Popov Čot. If you can bypass the peak, following the path to it, you will reach the former quarry and the entrance to Grgurevci Cave.
appMap.description_long_rs:
Izletište Popov čot se nalazi pokraj Partizanskog puta, neposredno pre skretanja za Grgurevce, a lokacija je označena drvenom tablom sa natpisom.

U skorije vreme ovde je izgrađena planinska etno-kuća s ograđenim dvorištem, atomsferu upotpunjuje i vojvođanski čardak koji se nalazi blizu kuće. Po dvorištu su raštrkani stolovi i klupe za odmor, a postoji i dečji kutak. Iza ograđenog dvorišta, u pravcu zapada, nalaze se vrh i zaravan koji nose naziv Popov čot. Ukoliko se zaobiđe vrh, prateći put koji dovodi do njega, stiže se do nekadašnjeg kamenoloma gde se nalazi ulaz u Grgurevačku pećinu.

appMap.description_en: This inexhaustible spring, discovered during the oil rush, is the farthermost from the forest, around 5 km away from Bingula.
appMap.description_rs: Jedan od najudaljenijih izvora od šume, nastao prilikom traženja nafte, nalazi se na oko 5 km od Bingule i neprestano osvežava sremsku ravnicu.
appMap.description_long_en: The spring can be found at around 5 km from the village of Bingula. It can be reached by the dirt road to the village of Kuzmin. This spring is one of the farthermost from the forest. The locals say it was discovered in the 70s, while the terrain was probed for oil. A pipe was placed in the ground, and it has served as an inexhaustible source of water refreshing the flatlands of Srem since then. The Belgrade-Zagreb highway runs 1.5 km away from the spring.
appMap.description_long_rs: Izvor se nalazi na oko 5 kilometara od sela Bingula. Do njega se dolazi zemljanim putem koji vodi ka selu Kuzmin. To je jedan od najudaljenijih izvora od šume. Meštani kažu da je izvor nastao tako što su ljudi prilikom traženja nafte i ispitivanja terena sedamdesetih godina naišli na vodu. Od tada stoji cev u zemlji i služi kao nepresušni izvor vode koja osvežava sremačku ravnicu. Na oko 1,5 kilometara od izvora se nalazi auto-put Beograd–Zagreb.

appMap.description_en: The most famous intersection on Fruška Gora is where Partisan Road and the Ruma – Novi Sad highway meet. There are many camps and picnic areas in the...
appMap.description_rs: Najpoznatija raskrsnica Fruške gore gde se seku Partizanski put i magistralni put Ruma – Novi Sad mesto je sa većim brojem lokacija za izlet i kampovanje.
appMap.description_long_en:
Iriški Venac is the famous pass and intersection on Fruška Gora. The highest ridge in Vojvodina, intersecting Partsan Road and the Ruma-Novi Sad highway, connects Novi Sad, which is about 20 kilometers away, with the southern parts of the country (Srem, Mačva). The very crossroad features a gas station, restaurant, and camp. Just by Partisan Road, leading to the western part of Fruška Gora, toward Brankovac and Letenka, there are many camps and picnic areas.

East of Iriški Venac stand the Sloboda statue, the TV tower, and the hotel Norcev.
appMap.description_long_rs:
Iriški venac je najpoznatiji putni prevoj i raskrsnica na Fruškoj gori. Najviši prevoj u Vojvodini, gde se seku Partizanski put i magistralni put Ruma – Novi Sad, spaja oko 20 kilometara udaljeni Novi Sad sa južnijim delovima zemlje (Srem, Mačva). Na samoj raskrsnici se nalaze benzinska pumpa, restoran, deo za kampovanje. Neposredno pokraj Partizanskog puta, od raskrsnice ka zapadnom delu Fruške Gore, u pravcu Brankovca i Letenke, nalazi se veći broj lokacija za izlet i kampovanje.

Istočno od Iriškog venca nalaze se spomenik Sloboda, TV toranj i hotel „Norcev”.

appMap.description_en: According to legend, Zmaj Ognjeni Vuk founded Grgeteg Monastery for his blind father in the 15th century. It is located in Grgeteg by the forest.
appMap.description_rs: Manastir Grgeteg, koji je po legendi osnovao Zmaj Ognjeni Vuk u XV veku za svog slepog oca, smešten je povrh istoimenog mesta uz gustu fruškogorsku šumu.
appMap.description_long_en:
This nunnery is located at the end of Grgeteg, right by the dense forest of Fruška Gora. Legend has it that Grgeteg Monastery and its Church of Saint Nikola were founded by the famous despot Zmaj Ognjeni Vuk (Vuk Branković) for his blind father, in as early as the 15th century. The old stone church was replaced with a baroque construction back in the 18th century. Next to the iconostasis, painted in 1902. by Uroš Predić, stands the acclaimed icon "Trojeručicа", bringing numerous pilgrims to the Monastery.

Grgeteg Monastery used to be a rather wealthy monastery, with four mills, nine water mills, and 200 acres of arable fields, wineyards, and meadows. The monastery grounds contain a prominent geological and paleonological site east of the Monastery gate at Kalin stream.

The Monastery suffered great damages during the Second World War, when the bell tower and most of the dormitories were demolished. Today, the monastery consists of the church encircled with dormitories, and a building for economical matters.

By taking the well-trodden summer path, you can reach Velika Remeta Monastery, which is only a kilometer away as the crow flies.
appMap.description_long_rs:
Ovaj ženski manastir je smešten povrh istoimenog mesta uz gustu fruškogorsku šumu. Legenda kaže da je manastir Grgeteg sa Crkvom Svetog Nikole osnovao Zmaj Ognjeni Vuk za svog slepog oca još u XV veku. Stara kamena crkva je u XVIII veku zamenjena baroknom građevinom. Pored ikonostasa koji je 1902. godine naslikao Uroš Predić, u hrаmu se nаlаzi ikonа Trojeručicа, te mаnаstir pohode mnogobrojni hodočаsnici.

Nekada je ovaj manastir bio dobrostojeći sa četiri mlina, devet vodenica i 200 jutara zemlje pod oranicama, vinogradima i livadama. U sklopu manastirskog kompleksa, istočno od manastirske kapije u Kalin potoku, nalazi se geološko-paleontološko nalazište od velikog značaja.

U Drugom svetskom rаtu mаnаstir je teško oštećen, srušen je zvonik i veliki deo konаkа. Dаnаs mаnаstirski kompleks čine crkvа, konаci sа sve četiri strаne i ekonomske zgrаde.

Trošnim letnjim putem je moguće doći do manastira Velika Remeta, koji je udaljen svega jedan kilometar vazdušnom linijom.

appMap.description_en: Not far from Beočin Monastery lies the Tree Nursery for ornamental trees and shrubs of the National Park Fruška Gora.
appMap.description_rs: Nedaleko od manastira Beočin nalazi se Rasadnik ukrasnog drveća i šiblja Nacionalnog parka Fruška gora.
appMap.description_long_en: Not far from Beočin Monastery lies the Tree Nursery for ornamental trees and shrubs of the National Park Fruška Gora. Oak seedlings in preparation for being prepared for reforestation are the most represented at the Nursery, the rest being mostly house plants. This entire area was once covered with saplings of various deciduous and conifer trees, meant for commercial sale, and not just National Park needs.
appMap.description_long_rs: Nedaleko od manastira Beočin nalazi se rasadnik ukrasnog drveća i šiblja Nacionalnog parka Fruška gora. Danas su u ovom rasadniku najviše zastupljene sadnice hrasta koje se pripremaju za pošumljavanje i tek pokoja vrsta ukrasnog bilja. Nekada je celo ovo područje bilo prekriveno mladicama raznih vrsta lišćara i četinara koje su služile i za komercijalnu prodaju, a ne samo za potrebe nacionalnog parka.

appMap.description_en: Locals still call this old church, deteriorated with the passage of time, "German". The ruined altar and dome stand in witness to this building's tumultuous...
appMap.description_rs: Staru crkvu, podleglu zubu vremena, meštani još nazivaju „švapska”. Spoljni zidovi, tragovi oltara i stare kupole svedoci su burne prošlosti ove građevine
appMap.description_long_en:
When heading for Novi Sad from the village of Banoštor, you will run across the Catholic Church of Saint Rudolph, known among the locals as shwapska ("German"). Neo-Romanticist Catholic churches are a rare sight in the villages of Fruška Gora. It was built in 1912. on the lands of count Rudolph Chotek of Futog, who financed the construction in the name of the then predominately German population. The tall bell-tower, separated from the central part of the Church, used to have three ornate bells.

When the Germans left the area after the war, the Church rapidly deteriorated due to lack of upkeep, and today, all that remains are the outer walls, and no roof. The neglected stairway leads to the entrance, above which stands an ornate interwoven capital, and a marble plaque stating the date of construction and the Saint it is dedicated to. The interior is covered in graffiti that is up to thirty years old, and remains of an altar stand at the opposite end. The top of the tower still have some remnants of the former dome, with a new addition, a stork nest.
appMap.description_long_rs:
Na izlasku iz sela Banoštor, u smeru ka Novom Sadu, nalazi se Crkva Svetog Rudolfa, koju lokalni meštani nazivaju „švapska”. Katoličke crkve sa neoromaničkim stilom gradnje, puput ove, prava su retkost u fruškogorskim selima. Sagrađena je 1912. godine na posedu grofa Rudolfa Choteka iz Futoga koji je i finansirao gradnju crkve za tadašnje većinsko nemačko stanovništvo. Visoki toranj je odvojen od centralnog dela crkve i svojevremeno je sadržao tri kitnjasta zvona.

Odlaskom Nemaca nakon završetka rata, crkva je ubrzano propadala jer niko više o njoj nije vodio računa, tako da su danas praktično ostali samo spoljni zidovi, bez svoda. Zapuštene stepenice vode ka ulazu iznad koga se nalazi kapitel u pletenoj ornamentici. Iznad ulaza je mermerna ploča sa datumom izgradnje i imenom sveca kome je posvećena. Unutrašnje strane zidova su išarane brojnim grafitima i potpisima koji su stari i po trideset godina, a na suprotnom kraju naziru se tragovi oltara. Na vrhu tornja se naziru tragovi kupole koja je nekad postojala, a sada je tu sveo gnezdo jedan par roda.

appMap.description_en: The late 20th century Spitzer Castle is one of the most significant examples of Eclecticism in Vojvodinian architecture.
appMap.description_rs: Dvorac porodice Špicer s kraja XX veka, jedan od značajnijih primera eklektične arhitekture u Vojvodini.
appMap.description_long_en:
The castle was built in 1892. by the respectable Spitzer family, who were one of the owners of the Beočin cement factory. This building is a significant example of Eclecticism in Vojvodinian architecture, which is dominated by styles characteristic to the end of the 19th century, and the beginning of the 20th century. Traces of romantic, gothic, renaissance, and baroque architecture can be found here, as well as some more modern elements, such as art nouveau and the secession.

Today, this castle is abandoned and of no practical use. After the owners retreated into Germany, it has been nationalized, and used as a school, a library, a cultural center, a home for the disabled, and eventually, as a restaurant. The state of this dilapidated beauty is best described by the name the local population has given it - a ghost house. The object has no doors or windows, the facade has decrepitated, and it could collapse at any moment, as the sign out front says. It was considered a cultural monument in the 1990s, but today, because of its condition, it cannot be entered without a permit from the municipal authorities.

On the other hand, the castle is a favorite among directors and movie crews. Some of the more famous movies that were filmed here are “Breakfast with the Devil”, “Der Junge mit der Geige”, and “Black Cat, White Cat”

Spitzner Castle is located near central Beočin, toward the monastery.
appMap.description_long_rs:
Dvorac je sagrađen 1892. godine i u vlasništvu ugledne porodice Špicer, jednog od glavnih vlasnika beočinske fabrike cementa. Ovo zdanje je značajan predstavnik eklektične arhitekture u Vojvodini u kome dominiraju stilovi karakteristični s kraja XIX i početka XX veka, tako da se mogu primetiti elementi romantike, gotike, renesanse i baroka, pa sve do modernih strujanja poznatih kao jugendstil, art noveau ili secesija.

Danas je ovaj dvorac napušten i bez praktične namene. Nakon odlaska vlasnika u Nemačku, nacionalizovan je i korišćen jedno vreme kao škola, zatim biblioteka, Dom kulture, Dom za invalide i, na kraju, kao restoran. Današnje stanje ove oronule lepotice najbolje oslikava naziv koji su joj okolni meštani nadenuli – „kuća duhova”. Na objektu nema ni prozora ni vrata, fasada je oronula, a postoji i mogućnost urušavanja, na šta upozorava tabla na ulazu na plac. Devedesetih godina prošlog veka proglašeno spomenikom kulture, a danas, zbog stanja u kom se nalazi, zdanje je u koje se ne može ući bez dozvole opštinskih vlasti.

S druge strane, zanimljivo je da je dvorac omiljeno mesto reditelja i filmskih ekipa. Neki od poznatijih filmova koji su ovde snimani su „Doručak s đavolom”, „Dečak i violina”, „Crna mačka, beli mačor”...

Dvorac se nalazi nedaleko od centra Beočina u pravcu manastira.

appMap.description_en: The spring in the heart of the forest is 3km from Bukovac, and a must-see stop for mountaineers and nature lovers.
appMap.description_rs: Izvor u srcu šume, na oko tri kilometra od Bukovca, nezaobilazno mesto planinara i ljubitelja prirode.
appMap.description_long_en: The spring in the heart of the forest 3km from Bukovac is called Vilina vodica (fairy water). If you go from the village, you’re in for a lovely walk and wondrous sights. This famous spring in Bukovac is known from ancient times by its healing properties, so it’s no wonder about the name it carries. The unmissable spot for mountaineers and nature lovers, this spring is known for the Đurđevdan reveille, which is traditionally organised every year.
appMap.description_long_rs: U srcu šume, na oko tri kilometra od Bukovca, nalazi se izvor Vilina vodica. Ukoliko se uputite iz sela, čeka vas ugodna šetnja kroz neverovatan krajolik. Ovaj čuveni bukovački izvor poznat je od davnina i po svojim blagotvornim dejstvima, stoga i ne čudi ime koji nosi. Nezaobilazno mesto planinara i ljubitelja prirode, ovaj izvor je poznat i po Đurđevdanskom uranku koji se tradicionalno organizuje svake godine.

appMap.description_en: Not far from Čortanovci beach, just by the mountain lodge, sits the Četiri Kamena (four stones) spring.
appMap.description_rs: Nedaleko od čortanovačke plaže, odmah pored planirarskog doma, nalazi se izvor Četiri kamena.
appMap.description_long_en: Not far from Čortanovci beach, just by the mountain lodge, sits the  Četiri Kamena (four stones) spring. People from Čortanovci and nearby villages come here to gather water, and during the summer, swimmers from the nearby beach come here to refresh themselves. The path next to it leads to Kozarica spring.
appMap.description_long_rs: Nedaleko od čortanovačke plaže, odmah pored planirarskog doma, nalazi se izvor Četiri kamena. Ljudi iz Čortanovaca i obližnjih naselja dolaze po vodu, a osveženje leti nalaze i kupači s obližnje plaže. Putićem pored može se stići do izvora Kozarica.

appMap.description_en: As one of the most beautiful beaches along the Danube, it augments the fascinating Čortanovci Park.
appMap.description_rs: Kao jedna od lepših plaža na Dunavu, obogaćuje čortanovački park prirode gde se mogu obići veoma interesantne lokacije.
appMap.description_long_en:
The Čortanovci forest road leads toward the Danube, or rather a beach and beach-house compound. As one of the more beautiful beaches along the Danube, it augments the fascinating Čortanovci Park. The beach is regulated, it has changing rooms, sunshades, a kids’ park, and similar amenities. Food and refreshments can be bought in the local cafes and čardas - traditional restaurants. The view from the beach overlooks the Kovilj - Petrovaradin marshes, and the Čortanovci islet. The circular path leads around local sources and historical sites.

Čortanovci beach is also home to the famous Willow of Love, which was a filming location for the movie “The Elusive Summer of ‘68”.
appMap.description_long_rs:
Put čortanovačke šume vodi ka Dunavu, tačnije prema plaži i vikend-naselju. Kao jedna od lepših plaža na Dunavu, posebno obogaćuje čortanovački park prirode. Plaža je uređena, poseduje svlačionice, suncobrane, park za najmlađe i ostale neophodne ugodnosti. Hrana i osveženja dostupni su u obližnjim kafićima i čardama. Pogled sa plaže pruža se ka Koviljsko-petrovaradinskom ritu i čortanovačkoj adi. Kružnom stazom mogu se obići obližnji izvori i istorijski lokaliteti.

Inače, na čortanovačkoj plaži je čuvena Vrba ljubavi, lokacija na kojoj su snimane scene za film „Varljivo leto 68”.

appMap.description_en: At the very edge of the Danube, in Čortanovačka forest, lie the ruins of a Roman military fortress Castra Herculis.
appMap.description_rs: Na samoj obali Dunava u čortanovačkoj šumi nalaze se ostaci rimskog vojnog utvrđenja Castra Herculis
appMap.description_long_en: At the very edge of the Danube, in Čortanovačka forest, lie the ruins of a Roman military fortress Castra Herculis. It was built by general Hercules in 3 BC, as defense against the Avars and other tribes. The beginning of the 90s saw archeological digs on this site, and a part of the wall was uncovered, while the remains of a Roman graveyard were found back. This modest reminder of the history of the Roman Empire is probably not the most attractive location in the region, but it is certainly worthy of some attention, considering the period of time it hails from.
appMap.description_long_rs: Na samoj obali Dunava u čortanovačkoj šumi nalaze se ostaci rimskog vojnog utvrđenja Castra Herculis. Ono je sagrađeno na čelu sa vojskovođom Herkulom u III veku nove ere radi odbrane od Avara i ostalih plemena. Početkom devedesetih na ovom mestu vršena su istraživanja tokom kojih je iskopan i jedan deo zida, a u pozadini utvđenja nađeni su i ostaci rimskog groblja. Ovaj skromni podsetnik istorije rimske imperije verovatno nije najatraktivnija lokacija na ovom prostoru, ali svakako zavređuje malu pažnju s obzirom na dašak vremena koji dočarava.

appMap.description_en: A memorial fountain was built not far from Čortanovačka beach, as a lasting memory of the six sailors who lost their lives on the ship Rugovo.
appMap.description_rs: Nedaleko od čortanovačke plaže izgrađena je spomen-česma kao trajno sećanje na šest brodara koji su izgubili život na brodu Rugovo.
appMap.description_long_en: The somewhat forgotten and abandoned site, not far from Čortanovačka beach is a lasting memory to the unfortunate events in 1970. when six sailors lost their lives on the ship Rugovo. This memorial fountain was built in their honor.
appMap.description_long_rs: Pomalo zaboravljeno i zapušteno mesto nedaleko od čortanovačke plaže podseća na nemio događaj iz 1970. godine na brodu Rugovo kada je život izgubilo šest brodara. U znak sećanja na njih izgrađeno je ovo spomen-obeležje.

appMap.description_en: The spring near Čortanovci forest is not far from the Danube shore, and it is an important landmark of Čortanovci.
appMap.description_rs: Izvor u čortanovačkoj šumi nedaleko od obale Dunava, važna znamenitost Čortanovaca.
appMap.description_long_en: Kozarica is located in Čortanovci forest, not far from the Danube shore. According to legend, St. Sava passed by here in the 12th century, on his way to Kovilj, to make peace between his brother Stefan Nemanjić, the Grand Prince of Serbia, and king Andrew II of Hungary. For this reason, the path by the spring is called Savinac, as is the spring itself. The spring was erected in 1890, and it has stood the test of time until 2006, when it was finally renovated. Other than refreshing spring water, you can also find pleasant surroundings and a lovely view upon the Danube here.
appMap.description_long_rs: Nalazi se u čortanovačkoj šumi nedaleko od obale Dunava. Prema priči, u XII veku Sveti Sava je prošao putem prema Kovilju da pomiri brata Stevana sa mađarskim kraljem Andrijom. Stoga se taj put pored izvora naziva Savinac, a neretko i izvor tako nazivaju. Izvor je podignut 1890. godine i odolevao je zubu vremena sve do 2006. godine, kada je konačno renoviran. Pored dobrog osveženja, na ovom izvoru uživaćete u prirodi i lepom pogledu na Dunav.

appMap.description_en: One of the few, rare places in the Pannonian Plain where sediments are built in continuity. Contains fossil remains of molluscs.
appMap.description_rs: Jedno je od retkih mesta u Panonskoj niziji gde je taloženje sedimenata vršeno u kontinuitetu. Sadrži fosilne ostatke mekušaca.
appMap.description_long_en:
Start from the gates of the Grgeteg monastery, follow the Kalin stream, and you’ll end up at the geological-paleontological deposits. It’s one of the few, rare places in the Pannonian Plain where sediments are built in continuity. This humble deposit hides rich sediments of fossil molluscs from early Pliocene. (1,8 million years ago) and even earlier.

Some of the mollusc fossils have first been found here, which put Grgeteg on the map of geological-paleontological findings in the world. Traces of the freshwater marsh sediments of the Viviparus snail have been found, as well as shells, ostracods and more.

Because of its scientific value, this place has been put under protection in 1973. by the  Institute for Nature Conservation.
appMap.description_long_rs:
Nedaleko od kapije manastira Grgeteg, uz Kalin potok, nalazi se geološko-paleontološko nalazište. Jedno je od retkih mesta u Panonskoj niziji gde je taloženje sedimenata vršeno u kontinuitetu. Ovo skromno nalazište krije bogate sedimente fosilnih ostataka mekušaca iz doba Donjeg Pliocena (1,8 miliona godina p. n. e.), kao i ranijih perioda.

Neki od fosila mekušaca su pronađeni prvi put na ovom mestu, što je Grgeteg stavilo na mapu svetskih paleontološko-geoloških nalazišta. Pronađene su slatkovodne naslage barskog puža Viviparus, školjke i ostrakodi iz kaspibrakičnih voda i drugo.

Zbog svoje naučne vrednosti, ovo mesto je stavljeno pod zaštitu 1973. godine od strane Zavoda za zaštitu prirode.

appMap.description_en: The tender age of 19 the young partisan and fighter Radinka Vitasović sacrificed herself for her country. This monument at Fruška Gora is dedicated to her.
appMap.description_rs: Sa samo 19 godina mlada partizanka i borkinja Radinka Vitasović Lepinjica dala je život za svoju domovinu. U to ime podignut joj je spomenik na Fruškoj gori.
appMap.description_long_en:
Near Letenka, next to the Partizanski road, is the Lepinjica monument. This is where the partisan member Radinka Vitasović, nicknamed Lepinjica, was buried. The brave woman was born in Laćarak, and is sister to the national hero Trivun Vitasović. She was wounded after the “Ambush at Neštin” on 23rd August 1943, which was organised by the Vojvodina brigada against the nazzi ocupators. The Supreme Headquarters of the National Liberation Movement of Vojvodina was located here during the World War II.

Follow the meadow in the forest and you’ll get to the Široki Do spring site.
appMap.description_long_rs:
Nedaleko od Letenke, pored Partizanskog puta, nalazi se spomen-obeležje Lepinjica. Na ovom mestu je sahranjena partizanka Radinka Vitasović, zvana Lepinjica. Ova hrabra žena poreklom je iz Laćarka i rođena sestra narodnog heroja Trivuna Vitasovića. Podlegla je ranama nakon „Zasede kod Neština” 23. avgusta 1943, koju je organizvala Treća udarna vojvođanska brigada protiv okupatora nacista. Na ovom potesu je tokom Drugog svetskog rata boravio Vrhovni štab Narodnooslobodilačkog pokreta Vojvodine.

Nedaleko od spomenika niz livadu u šumi nalazi se izvor Široki Do.

appMap.description_en: Down the meadow next to the Lepinjica monument, on the brink of the forest, is the Široki Do springs.
appMap.description_rs: Niz livadu pored spomen-obeležja Lepinjica, na rubu šume, nalazi se izvor Široki Do.
appMap.description_long_en: Follow the meadow down the Lepinjica monument, and on the brink of the forest you’ll find the Široki Do spring. A sign forbidding entrance is the first thing you see, but it only applies to the fenced area. Find the pipes shooting the fresh water in the back.
appMap.description_long_rs: Niz livadu pored spomen-obeležja Lepinjica, na rubu šume, nalazi se izvor Široki Do. Znak za zabranu pristupa koji se prvi uočava odnosi se samo na ograđeni prostor. Odmah iza nalaze se cevi iz kojih izbija voda.

appMap.description_en: Bobelik Meadow, also known as Tepsija, is lovated by the road that leads to Ležimir, near the crossroads with the Partizanski road.
appMap.description_rs: Bobelikova livada, poznata i po nazivu Tepsija, nalazi se pokraj puta koji vodi ka Ležimiru, nedaleko od rakrsnice sa Partizanskim putem.
appMap.description_long_en:
Bobelik Meadow, also known as Tepsija, is lovated by the road that leads to Ležimir, near the crossroads with the Partizanski Road.

This picnic site is surrounded by forest on all sides, and its green surfaces are round and flat, so it resembles a pan (tepsija in serbian). That’s why it was unofficialy named after the culinary utensil. Bobelik Meadow is an ideal place for resting and a picnic during the 1st May holidays, especially because of the few wooden tables and benches there.
appMap.description_long_rs:
Bobelikova livada, poznata i po nazivu Tepsija, nalazi se pokraj puta koji vodi ka Ležimiru, nedaleko od rakrsnice sa Partizanskim putem.

Ovo izletište je okruženo šumom sa svih strana, i svojom zelenom površinom ravnog i kružnog oblika neodoljivo podseća na tepsiju, zbog čega je i dobilo nezvaničan naziv po toj kulinarskoj posudi. Bobelikova livada je idealno mesto za odmor i piknik tokom prvomajskih praznika, između ostalog, i zbog nekoliko drvenih stolova sa klupama.

appMap.description_en: The remains of former buildings attest the violent and rich history of the area.
appMap.description_rs: Ostaci nekadašnjih građevina svedoče o burnoj i bogatoj istoriji ovog područja.
appMap.description_long_en:
The archeological sight Gradina is situated in Rakovac, and is a greatly important cultural property that’s protected by state laws. The settlement from the early stone age, ie Neolithic period, was created 7000 years ago.

The roman villa was built during late antiquiety, and you can still see its remains, which are over 1600 years old. Stone and brick have been used building materials. The basilica and the monastery have been raised in 1100 and are dedicated to St. Đorđe. The churches and monastery have been torn down and rebuilt in the later centuries, and at one point served as forts. When the Turks came in the 16th century, Gradina was emptied and abandoned, only to have it rise again as today’s Rakovac settlement.

The remains of former buildings serve as witnesses to the violent and rich history of the area.
appMap.description_long_rs:
Arheološko nalazište Gradina nalazi se u Rakovcu, i kao kulturno dobro od velikog značaja pod zaštitom je države. Naselje iz starijeg kamenog doba, neolita, datira iz perioda od pre 7000 godina.

Rimska vila je sagrađena u vreme kasne antike, a njeni ostaci, stari preko 1600 godina, vidljivi su i danas. Kamen i opeka su korišćeni kao građevinski materijali. Bazilika i manastir su podignuti 1100. godine i posvećeni su Svetom Đorđu. Crkve i manastir su u kasnijim vekovima rušeni i obnavljani, a jedno vreme imali su formu i ulogu utvrđenja. Sa dolaskom Turaka u XVI veku Gradina je opustela, da bi kasnije na ovom području niklo današnje naselje Rakovac.

appMap.description_en: Near the Danube coast is the castle which first belonged to the Marčibanji family. It was built by the end of the 18th and the beginning of the 19th century.
appMap.description_rs: Nedaleko od obale Dunava nalazi se dvorac koji je prvobitno bio u vlasništvu porodice Marcibanji, sagrađen je krajem XVIII i početkom XIX veka.
appMap.description_long_en:
Near the Danube coast is the castle which first belonged to the Marčibanji family. It was built by the end of the 18th and the beginning of the 19th century. It was reconstructed and expanded thanks to its new owners, the Karačonji family, in the middle of the 19th century, and its looks remain largely unchanged today. The building is quite representative, built in classic style, with the colonnade of Doric columns and ornaments made of wrought iron. The entire formation is formed from four objects, and its circled by the english garden, which was at first decorated with exotic trees from around the world and sculptures of sphinx and lions. The park had walking paths, riding paths, and a lake. The sculpture remains can be still seen in the former garden.

The wealthy Karačonji family held balls and receptions in its castle until 1918. However, after the war this opulent property was nationalised and used for multiple purposes. Today the castle remains as property of the JVP “Vode Vojvodine” (Waters of Vojvodina). Apart from the graffiti and the mostly ruined or broken sculptures in the park, the building is pretty good shape.
appMap.description_long_rs:
Nedaleko od obale Dunava nalazi se dvorac koji je bio u prvobitnom vlasništvu porodice Marcibanji. Sagrađen je krajem XVIII i početkom XIX veka. Današnji oblik dobija dogradnjom i rekonstrukcijom zahvaljujući novim vlasnicima, porodici Karačonji, sredinom XIX veka. Građevina je reprezentativna, izgrađena u klasicističkom stilu, sa kolonadama dorskih stubova i ornamentikom od kovanog gvožđa. Celo zdanje je formirano od četiri objekta, a okruženo je engleskim pejzažnim vrtom, prvobitno ukrašenim egzotičnim drvećem iz celog sveta i skulpturama sfingi i lavova. Park je imao pešačke staze, staze za jahanje i poribljeno jezero, a ostaci skulptura i nekadašnjeg vrta vidljivi su i danas.

Imućna porodica Karačonji je sve do 1918. godine održavala balove i prijeme u svom dvorcu. Međutim, posle rata, ovo velelepno zdanje je nacionalizovano i korišćeno višenamenski. Danas se dvorac nalazi u privremenom vlasništvu JVP Vode Vojvodine i, izuzev grafita i skulptura u parku koje su većinom porušene i polomljene, vrlo dobro je očuvan.

appMap.description_en: Orlovo bojište is a former quarry, where you’ll catch a breathtaking view of Fruška Gora.
appMap.description_rs: Orlovo bojište je nekadašnji kamenolom, sa čijeg vrha se pušta prelep pogled na Iriški venac.
appMap.description_long_en:
Orlovo bojište is a former quarry,  where you’ll catch a breathtaking view of Fruška Gora. Once you reach the wooden fence, you’ll find green hills dominated by the Iriški Venac in the distance.

The favourite spot for mountaineers and sport climbers won their favour by being the perfect place for practicings climbing skills and organizing improvised polygons. You’ll find cute info panels that point towards some of the highest points in the world.

The plan for this location is to have a mountain association hut built for professional climbers and free-climbing, to serve as a certain mountaineering centre. For now, though, it’s nothing more than empty words on a piece of paper, without any indication of whether or not the hut is going to truly be built. However, the bursting enthusiasm of local climbing fans shows no signs of simmering down.
appMap.description_long_rs:
Orlovo bojište je nekadašnji kamenolom sa čijeg vrha se pušta prelep pogled na Iriški venac. Omiljeno je mesto planinara i sportskih penjača koji se ovde okupljaju da vežbaju i organizuju svoje improvizovane poligone.

Ovde je u planu izgradnja planinarskog doma i profesionalnog penjališta za freeclimbing, s ciljem da čitava lokacija postane neka vrsta planinarskog centra. Entuzijazma lokalnih fruškogorskih ljubitelja planinarenja i alpinizma svakako ne manjka.

appMap.description_en: Perina Pećina cave, one of the unique sites of its kind at Fruška Gora, is hidden deep in forest.
appMap.description_rs: Perina pećina jedan je od jedinstvenih lokaliteta ovog tipa na Fruškoj gori.
appMap.description_long_en:
Perina Pećina cave, one of the unique sites of its kind at Fruška Gora, is hidden deep in forest, near Stari Ledinci and Popovica. You’ll find it by a narrow forest road. The cave is supposedly a remnant of an old mine; the roots of its name, however, are uncertain. Local folk say there used to be this guy named Pera, who owned the mine; others say the very same Pera died in the cave. The entrance is so narrow, an average person barely fits through it. Once you go in, the cave branches out into two tunnels, both reclining into a slight slope.The tunnels are 70 meters long.

Entry is strictly forbidden, as evidenced by the bars in front. Luckily, there’s an info post put up that contains the cave’s geology and photos of the interior. Something’s better than nothing, we guess.
appMap.description_long_rs:
Perina pećina jedan je od jedinstvenih lokaliteta ovog tipa na Fruškoj gori. Nalazi se sakrivena duboko u šumi, u blizini Starih Ledinaca i Popovice. Do nje vodi uzani šumski put. Pretpostavlja se da je pećina ostatak nekadašnjeg rudnika, a poreklo naziva nije poznato – po pričama lokalnog naroda postojao je izvesni Pera koji je bio vlasnik rudnika, a po drugima da je taj isti Pera umro u ovoj pećini. Ulaz u pećinu je veoma uzak i jedva dovoljan da se čovek prosečne veličine provuče. Nakon ulaska, pećina se grana na dva tunela koji se konstantno blago spuštaju. Ukupna dužina tunela je 70 metara.

Ulaz u pećinu je strogo zabranjen i na ulasku je postavljena rešetka. Srećom, postoji tabla sa osnovnim informacijama o geologiji pećine i prikazom unutrašnjosti, tako da se može steći uvid o izgledu pećine.

appMap.description_en: Popovica, one of Fruška Gora’s mountain points is also the start area of the Fruška gora marathon.
appMap.description_rs: Na kraju naselja Popovica, kraj okretnice autobuske linije 74, postoji malo mesto za kampovanje.
appMap.description_long_en:
Popovica is the name of the mountain top at Fruška gora, as well as the summer village in Sermska Kamenica near Novi Sad. If you travel by car, there’s a small camp area near the entrance to Popovica, right next to the nursing home. This is a great spot from which to go to other places at Popovica - the lake, spring site, or the viewpoint over Novi Sad and the Danube…

Popovica is also known as the start point of the Fruška Gora Marathon, organised annually in spring. You can also reach the summer village by taking the bus 74 from Novi Sad.
appMap.description_long_rs:
Popovica je naziv planinskog vrha na Fruškoj gori, a takođe i naziv naselja u Sremskoj Kamenici, nadomak Novog Sada. Na kraju naselja postoji malo mesto za kampovanje, kod Doma penzionera. Odavde se može krenuti dalje ka ostalim lokacijama na Popovici – jezero, izvor, vidikovac sa lepim pogledom na Dunav i Novi Sad.

Popovica je poznata i kao mesto starta Fruškogorskog maratona koji se organizuje u proleće svake godine. Do nje je moguće doći i gradskim autobusom (broj 74) iz Novog Sada.

appMap.description_en: A soft stream flows from a spring nestled in forest.
appMap.description_rs: Izvor tankog mlaza ušuškan u šumi nedaleko od popovičkog jezera.
appMap.description_long_en:
The spring site is located near the lake, cradled by forest, in a not-too-steep notch. There are signs posted on trees that point to you in the right direction. Cold water flows in a tranquil, solemn stream. The spring might dry-out during drought season.

To reach the spring site, you’ll need to pass a colourful house with a welcome messages sprawled on it. There’s also a hand painted National Park of Fruška Gora map by the road, too.
appMap.description_long_rs:
Izvor se nalazi nedaleko od jezera, ušuškan u šumi, u ne mnogo strmom useku. Postoje znakovi na drveću koji upućuju ka njegovom pravcu. Hladna voda teče u tankom mlazu.

Na putu do izvora prolazi se pokraj kućice interesantnog kolorita s ispisanom porukom dobrodošlice. Pokraj puta postoji i ručno oslikana mapa Nacionalnog parka Fruška gora.

appMap.description_en: A lake of emerald green serves as a fish hatchery near Popovica.
appMap.description_rs: Jezero smaragdne boje vode blizu Popovice. Mrestilište šarana.
appMap.description_long_en:
A humble, piercingly emerald lake resides by Popovica, a summer-house district. It’s near the picnic area. Take the Lake's road that’s by the crossroads at the picnic area. The lake is right beside it, surrounded by robust forestry.

There’s a carp hatchery in it, so if you get close you’ll be able to see lots of cute fish babies. This also means that fishing is prohibited.

Take the dirt road down the slope, and you’ll reach the spring site nearby.
appMap.description_long_rs:
Malo jezero smaragdne boje nalazi se kraj vikend-naselja Popovica, nedaleko od izletišta. Kod raskrsnice pokraj izletišta dalje treba ići Jezerskim putem. Jezero je odmah pokraj puta i okruženo je šumom.

U njemu se mresti šaran, a ukoliko se približite vodi, primetićete brojna jata riblje mlađi. Kao mrestilište, ono je zaštićeno i samim tim pecanje je strogo zabranjeno.

Ukoliko se spustite zemljanim putićem niz padinu, doći ćete do obližnjeg izvora.

appMap.description_en: A splendid view of Novi Sad and the Danube on one side, with Fruška Gora on the other.
appMap.description_rs: Prelep pogled na Novi Sad i Dunav, s jedne strane, i Frušku goru, sa druge – mesto za predah i uživanje.
appMap.description_long_en: Should you venture on a light walk from Popovica via the winding roads, you’ll probably end up at the viewpoint. We’d recommend you visit the lake in Popovica or even Perina cave, since they’re pretty close by. The generous view from this point spreads along Danube’s coastline in Novi Sad, Fruška Gora, and Ledinci. It’s truly one of those special places where you just can’t help but relax and enjoy the weather.
appMap.description_long_rs: Ako krenete od Popovice, laganom šetnjom vijugavim putićima iz više pravaca, možete doći do Dunavskog vidikovca. Usput možete obići jezero ili pak Perinu pećinu. Predivan pogled s ovog vidikovca proteže se duž obale Dunava na Novi Sad, Frušku goru i Ledince. Ovo mesto je kao stvoreno za predah i uživanje.

appMap.description_en: The memorial on top of Stražilovo is dedicated to the famous Serbian Romantic poet, Branko Radičević.
appMap.description_rs: Spomenik na Stražilovu posvećen poznatom srpskom romantičarskom pesniku Branku Radičeviću
appMap.description_long_en:
Branko’s Grave, a memorial dedicated to the famous Serbian Romantic poet, Branko Radičević (1824–1853), is located on top of Stražilovo, near Sremski Karlovci. Branko used to be a student of the Gymnasium of Karlovci, and this period of his life was immortalized in his best known poem „Đački rastanak” (the Parting of Schoolfriends), where he glorified Sremski Karlovci and the youthful life in them.

30 years following the poet’s death in Vienna, his bones were transferred to Stražilovo, and with the charity of the Serbian community, a stone memorial in the shape of a pyramid was built there. The stones within the foundations were brought from many regions where Serbs lived. Every block is marked with the location it originates from. The memorial was destroyed during World War II, but it was rebuilt shortly after.
appMap.description_long_rs:
Brankov grob, spomenik posvećen poznatom srpskom romantičarskom pesniku Branku Radičeviću (1824–1853), nalazi se na Stražilovu kraj Sremskih Karlovaca. Branko je bio đak Karlovačke gimnazije i ovaj period života će imati značajan uticaj na njegovo kasnije stvarlaštvo. U svojoj najpoznatijoj pesmi „Đački rastanak” opevao je Sremske Karlovce i mladalački život u njima.

Trideset godina posle pesnikove smrti u Beču njegovi posmrtni ostaci preneti su na Stražilovo, a dobrovoljnim prilozima srpske zajednice podignut je kameni spomenik u obliku piramide. Kameni blokovi u osnovi spomenika doneseni su iz brojnih krajeva naseljenih Srbima. Na svakom bloku postoji natpis mesta iz kog potiče taj kamen. Spomenik je uništen za vreme Drugog svetskog rata, ali je nakon toga brzo obnovljen.

Na spomeniku stoji kamena ploča sa poznatim natpisom: „Mnogo ‘teo, mnogo započeo, čas umrli njega je pomeo”.

appMap.description_en: A gorgeous viewpoint stretching over Karlovci, the Danube, and Bačka. This spot was dedicated to the serbian poet Duško Trifunović.
appMap.description_rs: Vidikovac s kog se pruža pogled na Karlovce, Dunav i Bačku. Ovo mesto je posvećeno srpskom pesniku Dušku Trifunoviću.
appMap.description_long_en:
A gorgeous viewpoint stretching over Karlovci, the Danube, and Bačka. It’s at two levels. The view over Karlovci makes you think that this small but dynamic village is soothed by the statue of the famous Serbian poet Duško Trifunović, to whom this place is dedicated. Rest up near Duško and enjoy the view.

In this world with a thousand miracles
each person lives their drama
let my song go down that path
there’s something in there for me.
appMap.description_long_rs:
Vidikovac s kog se pruža pogled na Karlovce, Dunav i Bačku. Nalazi se na dva nivoa. Pogledom na Karlovce stiče se utisak da ovu varošicu koja odiše dinamikom umiruje statua poznatog srpskog pesnika Duška Trifunovića, kome je ovo mesto i posvećeno. Odmorite se pored Duška i uživajte u pogledu.

U svetu ovom sa hiljadu čuda
svaki čovek živi svoje drame,
i moja pesma neka pođe tuda
u svemu tome ima nešto za me.

appMap.description_en: A small, lonely lake, hidden behind the fields of Sremski Karlovci, seems stifled in the scenery.
appMap.description_rs: Ovo malo osamljeno jezero u karlovačkim atarima tokom određenih perioda u godini više podseća na baru.
appMap.description_long_en: A small, lonely lake, hidden behind the fields of Sremski Karlovci, seems stifled in the scenery. It resembles a pond, rather than a lake, during the hotter months in the year. It sits at the foot of Vezirac hill, and it got its name from it. The hill itself is known for the Vezirac memorial, and the battle that took place here.
appMap.description_long_rs:
Maleno osamljeno jezero, skriveno u karlovačkim atarima, kao da se guši u ovom krajoliku. Usled pojedinih doba u godini, ponekad ostavlja utisak bare. Naziv je dobilo verovatno po brdu Vezirac ispod kog se nalazi, a samo brdo poznato je po spomeniku Vezirac i bici koja se tu odigrala.

Retki su kupači i pecaroši na ovom jezeru.

appMap.description_en: A former botanical garden that now echoes with the laughter of kids and frolicing pets.
appMap.description_rs: Nekadašnja botanička bašta ori se glasovima razigrane dece i ljubimaca.
appMap.description_long_en: This former botanical garden is located 500 meters from the centre of Sremski Karlovci, in the way of Stražilovo, at the road that goes over the stream. It’s a unique setting, ideal for a classroom in the open - often used by students of the Gymnasium of Karlovci. The garden was planted during the Patriarch Rajačić, and it’s said that Serbs all over the world who were educated here, including gymnasium students, brought back rare plants and trees, which are, sadly, today no longer present in the garden.
appMap.description_long_rs:
Ova nekadašnja botanička bašta nalazi se nekih 500 metara od centra, u pravcu Stražilova. Ona je jedinstvena učionica u prirodi, gde su se nekada, a i danas, okupljali đaci Karlovačke gimnazije i imali predavanja u prirodnom ambijentu. Nastala je za vreme patrijarha Rajačića, a kaže se i da su učeni Srbi iz sveta, kao i nekadašnji gimnazijalci ovde donosili retko bilje i drveće, međutim, danas tog egzotičnog bilja ovde nema.

Brojno drveće okružuje veliku livadu na kojoj se često mogu videti deca u igri, kao i ljudi sa svojim kućnim ljubimcima. Postavljeni su poligoni za igru dece, tako da veseli žamor prožima mirnoću ovog mesta.

Tu su i dva prilično oronula objekta čija trenutna namena nije poznata. Pretpostavlja se da su to nekadašnje staje za konje i seno.

Okružena drvećem, sa stablom u sredini, nalazi se i nekadašnja fontana, sada van funkcije.

appMap.description_en: Stražilovo is a peak of Fruška gora, at 321 meters above sea level. It is a well-known resort on Fruška gora, just 4 km away from Sremski Karlovci
appMap.description_rs: Stražilovo je vrh na Fruškoj gori, na 321 metru nadmorske visine. Poznato je fruškogorsko izletište, udaljeno četiri kilometra od Sremskih Karlovaca.
appMap.description_long_en:
Stražilovo is a peak of Fruška gora, at 321 meters above sea level. It is a well-known resort on Fruška gora, just 4 km away from Sremski Karlovci, and the greatest contribution to its relevance is the grave of a famous Serbian poet, Branko Radičević. This is a popular vacationing spot and outdoors getaway for the people of Sremski Karlovci, and it is also a gathering spot for young people and artists.

Brankov čardak, complete with restaurant and accommodation can be found here, and a statue of Branko Radičević stands in the meadow in front.
appMap.description_long_rs:
Stražilovo je vrh na Fruškoj gori, na 321 metru nadmorske visine. Poznato je fruškogorsko izletište, udaljeno četiri kilometra od Sremskih Karlovaca, a njegovom značaju najviše doprinosi grob poznatog srpskog pesnika Branka Radičevića. Popularno je mesto odmora i boravka u prirodi Karlovčana, a takođe i rado okupljalište mladih i umetnika.

Tu se nalazi odmaralište Brankov čardak sa restoranom i smeštajem, a na centralnoj livadi ispred postavljena je statua Branka Radičevića.

appMap.description_en: A symbol of the opulence in this part of Fruška gora, Villa Ravne takes us back to the good old times.
appMap.description_rs: Simbol raskoši za ovaj deo Fruške gore koji vraća sećanje na dobra stara vremena.
appMap.description_long_en:
In a forest near Sviloš, Villa Ravne has been a comme il faut symbol of this part of Fruška gora. The villa was built by the noble family Odescalchi from Ilok, primarily to enjoy the landscape. It changed several owners over time, until it received a national status after World War II.

The villa was sometimes used by the senior state official Aleksandar Ranković Leka, mostly for hunting. During the 70s, the villa was redecorated for the needs of Josip Broz Tito, but he only visited it once, briefly, in 1976. Because of this, the villa is sometimes called “Tito’s and Leka’s villa”.

Villa Ravne is currently empty, and in possession and care of the Autonomous Province of Vojvodina. The gorgeous meadows around the estate is used by the National Park for the reintroduction of the European Deer (Cervus elaphus, L). If you are quiet enough, you could even spot a few. The villa can be reached by a short woodland stroll down Partisan road.
appMap.description_long_rs:
U šumi nedaleko od Sviloša Vila Ravne već više od jednog veka nezaobilazno je obeležje ovog dela Fruške gore. Vilu je sagradila iločka plemićka porodica Odeskalski (Odescalchi) prvenstveno radi uživanja u fruškogorskom raju. Tokom vremena ona je menjala vlasnike, da bi na kraju, posle Drugog svetskog rata, dobila nacionalizovani status.

Vilu je ponekad koristio visoki državni funkcioner Aleksandar Ranković Leka, i to najviše za lov. Tokom sedamdesetih vila je preuređivana za potrebe Josipa Broza Tita, ali on ju je samo jednom prilkom 1976. godine na kratko posetio. Iz tih razloga ovu vilu ponekad nazivaju i „Titova i Lekina vila”.

Trenutno Vila Ravne je prazna i u vlasništvu AP Vojvodina, koja se brine o njoj. Prelepu livadu u sklopu poseda koristi Nacionalni park za reintrodukciju evropskog jelena (Cervus elaphus, L). Ukoliko ste dovoljno tihi, možete i ugledati neke od njih. Do vile se može doći i sa Partizanskog puta kratkom šetnjom kroz šumu.

appMap.description_en: Gora and the Danube marshes used to be the perfect hiding spots for hajduks. This spring was named to honor the hajduks and Laza Harambaša.
appMap.description_rs: Gora zajedno sa dunavskim ritovima svojevremeno predstavljala je idealno sklonište za hajduke. U čast hajduka i Laze Harambaše, ovaj izvor se zove Hajdučki.
appMap.description_long_en:
Fruška gora and the Danube marshes used to be the perfect hiding spots for hajduks - local freedom fighters. The hajduk Lazar Dobrić, known as Laza Harambaša, often used this field advantage. History remembers him as a smart, shrewd and witty hajduk, and his company consisted of other notable hajduks, like Stanoje Glavaš and Hajduk Veljko. They would rob Ottoman and Austro-Hungarian caravans, and give part of the loot to the poor. The spring was named to honor them.

The spring is located close to Partisan road, and because the road is so steep, a little caution can go a mile.
appMap.description_long_rs:
Svojevremeno su ovi krajolici predstavljali idealno sklonište za hajduke. Tu prednost terena koristio je i poznati hajduk Lazar Dobrić, zvani Laza Harambaša. Istorija piše da je bio vispren, pametan i duhovit hajduk, te da su u njegovoj družini bili već poznati hajduci Stanoje Glavaš i Hajduk Veljko. Pljačkajući turske i austrougarske karavane, deo svog plena bi uvek davali siromašnima. U njihovu čast ovaj izvor poneo je naziv Hajdučki.

Izvor se nalazi nedaleko od Partizanskog puta, a s obzirom na strminu koja vodi do njega, malo pažnje nije na odmet.

appMap.description_en: The spring dedicated to St. Demetrios was built in 1899. According to legend, it has healing powers, the most prominent of which is the power to heal sight.
appMap.description_rs: Izvor posvećen Svetom Dimitriju ustanovljen je 1899. godine. Po legendi, narod mu prepisuje razna lekovita svojstva, a naročito lečenja vida.
appMap.description_long_en:
The spring dedicated to St. Demetrios was built in 1899. According to legend, the people respected it greatly because of its healing powers, the most commonly mentioned one being the power to heal sight. Ubavac is on Velika Remeta monastery grounds, and the brotherhood of the monastery raised the chapel above it.

The spring can be reached by a gravel road that starts at the first large crossroad at the foot of the village.
appMap.description_long_rs:
Izvor posvećen Svetom Dimitriju ustanovljen je 1899. godine. Kako legenda kaže, narod ga je duboko poštovao zbog raznoraznih lekovitih svojstava, među kojima se najčešće ističe lečenje vida. Ovaj izvor spada u manastirski posed, te je bratstvo manastira Velika Remeta podiglo kapelu iznad.

Do izvora se stiže makadamom koji počinje na prvoj velikoj raskrsnici u podnožju sela.

appMap.description_en: The Airfield was meant for recreational and touristic flights, and it has been bringing aviation enthusiasts together for many years.
appMap.description_rs: Aerodrom je namenjen za sportsko-turističko letenje, okuplja zaljubljenike u vazduhoplovne sportove već duži niz godina.
appMap.description_long_en:
The airfield is located at the very entrance to the village, to the left side, coming from Sremska Mitrovica. It covers 23 acres. The airfield has no concrete runway, and it is primarily aimed at recreational flights. It is 1100 m long, and the runway can be used by singl-engine and double-engine aircrafts weighing up to 5700 kg.

The club has recreational aircraft and a motorized stunt kite, and it offers panoramic flight services, as well as parachuting lessons.
appMap.description_long_rs:
Aerodrom se nalazi na samom ulazu u selo sa leve strane iz pravca Sremske Mitrovice i prostire se na površini od 23 hektara. Aerodrom nema betonsku pistu i prvenstveno je namenjena za  sportsko-turističko letenje. Dužine je 1100 m i na pistu mogu da sleću jednomotorni i dvomotorni avioni težine do 5700 kg.

Klub raspolaže sportskim avionima i motornim zmajem, i vrši usluge panoramskog letenja i obuke u skakanju padobranom.

Svakako jedno od mesta koje se ne sme propustiti! Ljubazni članovi kluba će vas uputiti u tajne vazduhoplovnog sporta, a ukoliko ste avanturista, vožnja vazdušnom jedrilicom može predstavljati nesvakidašnji doživljaj.

appMap.description_en: This unfortunately sad place, where a life was extinguished, is a reminder of hard and oppressive times.
appMap.description_rs: Ovo tužno mesto na kome je oduzet jedan život predstavlja podsetnik na teška i represivna vremena.
appMap.description_long_en:
Near the Iriški Venac, next to the Partisan road, is a monument to Ivan Stambolić, the former president of the communist republic of Serbia. He was assassinated as per Slobodan Milošević’s orders in 2000.

This stone obelisk also represents a reminder for the hard and oppressive times. Three hundred meters down the road path is the second obelisk, a place where Ivan Stambolić was buried.
appMap.description_long_rs:
Nedaleko od Iriškog venca, pored Partizanskog puta, nalazi se spomen-obeležje Ivanu Stamboliću, bivšem predsedniku Presedništva Republike Srbije, kome je oduzet život po nalogu Slobodana Miloševića 2000. godine.

Ovaj kameni obelisk ujedno predstavlja i podsetnik na teška i represivna vremena.

Trista metara dalje niz šumski put nalazi se i drugi obelisk, odnosno mesto na kome je Ivan Stambolić bio zakopan.

appMap.description_en: The rest area is property of NIS (Naftagas), and was built in 1965 for company purposes. It is no longer in use.
appMap.description_rs: Odmaralište je u vlasništvu preduzeća NIS (Naftagas), a izgrađeno je 1965. godine za potrebe kompanije. Trenutno ne radi.
appMap.description_long_en:
The rest area is property of NIS (Naftagas), and was built in 1965 for company purposes. It is no longer in use.

The rest area is property of NIS (Naftagas), and was built in 1965 for company purposes, mainly banquets, celebrations, and employee holidays. After NIS was privatised, the company lost interest for it. The only visitors of the place now are security guirs who keep this place from falling apart. The rest area has an authentic small park for kids which has an eery, nostalgic feel to it.

The property is up for auction since 2012.
appMap.description_long_rs:
Odmaralište Osovlje nalazi se na oko 1500 m od raskrsnice Partizanskog i Beočinskog puta. Do odmarališta se može doći peške asfaltnim putem uz prateće znakove.

Objekat iz 1965. godine je u vlasništvu kompanije NIS (Naftagas) sa prvobitnom namenom organizvanja banketa, proslava i odmora zaposlenih u naftnoji industriji. Nakon privatizacije NIS-a, kompanija je izgubila interes za ovim odmaralištem. Jedini redovni posetioci su čuvari koji održavaju ovo mesto od propadanja. U sklopu odmarališta je autentičan mali park za decu koji nostalgično podseća na stara dobra vremena.

Odmaralište Osovlje se nalazi na aukciji od 2012. godine.

appMap.description_en: A small picnic area hidden in the forest near the Partizanski road. This place is the control point of the Fruška Gora marathon KT02.
appMap.description_rs: Malo izletište skriveno u šumarku pokraj Partizanskog puta. Ovo mesto je i kontrolna tačka Fruškogorskog maratona KT02.
appMap.description_long_en:
A small picnic area hidden in the forest near the Partizanski road. This place is the control point of the Fruška Gora marathon KT02.

Astali or Stolovi (tables) is a small picnic area hidden in the forest near the Partizanski road. There’s a sign marking this location, and it points out that we should be respectful towards nature. This place is the control point of the Fruška Gora marathon KT02. Tread through the forest or asphalt road and you’ll get to the Partisan memorial.
appMap.description_long_rs: Astali ili Stolovi je malo izletište skriveno u šumarku pokraj Partizanskog puta. Postoji tabla koja označava ovu lokaciju i upućuje na odgovorno ponašanje prema prirodi. Ovo mesto je i kontrolna tačka Fruškogorskog maratona KT02. Putem kroz šumu ili asfaltom može se stići do partizanskog spomen-obeležja.

appMap.description_en: Serbia’s great poet, Jovan Jovanović Zmaj, spent the last years of his life in this house. In 1933 it was adapted and opened to visitors.
appMap.description_rs: Poslednje godine svog života čika Jova Zmaj je proveo u ovoj kući. Ona je od 1933. adaptirana i otvorena za posetioce.
appMap.description_long_en:
In the very heart of Sremska Kamenica, on the main road, there’s a memorial collection “Jovan Jovanović Zmaj” (Zmaj museum). It’s currently a part of the Museum of Novi Sad, and Zmaj’s house witnesses the life and work of one of Serbia’s greatest romantics. The museum was founded by the “Zmaj” community, which began work in 1904.

Mr. Jovan Jovanović Zmaj spent the last years of his life in this house, which was adapted and opened for visitors in 1933. In the same year, diagonally across the house, a monument titled “From Children to Jova Zmaj” was erected, the work of the sculptor Stevan Stojanović. The monument features both the portaiture and power of J.J.Zmaj’s personality,a s well as the delicate world he built through children’s poetry. Twelve years after WW2 the museum was rebuilt and opened again.

The concept of a permanent exhibition is presented through categories: Zmaj’s family life, work on children’s literature, his posthumous work and more.

The museum is open from 09:00 - 16:00 from Monday to Friday and 09:00-14:00 on Saturday. Group visits must be announced a few days before arrival.
appMap.description_long_rs:
U samom centru Sremske Kamenice, na glavnom putu, nalazi se spomen–zbirka „Jovan Jovanović Zmaj” (Zmajev muzej). Trenutno u sastavu Muzeja grada Novog Sada, Zmajeva kuća predstavlja svedočanstvo života i rada jednog od najvećih srpskih romantičara. Muzej je osnovalo društvo „Zmaj”, koje je pokrenuto 1904. godine.

Poslednje godine svog života čika Jova Zmaj je proveo u ovoj kući, koja je 1933. adaptirana i otvorena za posetioce. Te iste godine je, dijagonalno od kuće, postavljen spomenik „Deca čika Jovi Zmaju”, rad skulptora Stevana Stojanovića koji portretiše istovremeno i snagu čika Jovine ličnosti, kao i tanani svet koji je izgradio kroz dečju poeziju. Dvanaest godina nakon II svetskog rata muzej je obnovljen i ponovo otvoren.

Koncept stalne postavke muzeja predstavljaju manje celine: Zmajev porodični život, rad na dečjoj književnosti, njegova posthumna dela i sl.

Muzej je otvoren od 9–16 h od ponedeljka do petka i od 9–14 h subotom. Grupne posete je neophodno najaviti nekoliko dana pre dolaska.

appMap.description_en: The Gypsy camp is a picnic area by Partizanski road. It is marked by two monuments dedicated to Partisan fighters and their war tactics.
appMap.description_rs: Ciganski logor je izletište uz Partizanski put. Glavna obeležja su dva spomenika posvećena partizanima i njihovim ratnim akcijama.
appMap.description_long_en: The Gypsy camp is a picnic area by Partizanski road. It is marked by two monuments dedicated to Partisan fighters and their war tactics. The first is dedicated to the 6th East Bosnia Division, and the second one to the 4th Troops of the Fruškogorska Partisan Division. This is a good place to have a breather and enjoy the cool shade cast by coniferous trees, which is a rare situation on Fruška Gora, since conifers are an allochthonous breed in this region.
appMap.description_long_rs: Ciganski logor je izletište uz Partizanski put. Glavna obeležja su dva spomenika posvećena partizanima i njihovim ratnim akcijama. Prvi je posvećen Šestoj istočnobosanskoj brigadi, a drugi Četvrtoj četi Fruškogorskog partizanskog odreda. Na ovom mestu možete da predahnete i uživate u hladu četinara, što je redak slučaj na Fruškoj gori, s obzirom na to da su oni alohtona vrsta na ovom podneblju.

appMap.description_en: Mošin grave is a picnic area dedicated to the partisan fighter Boško Sanadrović Moša, a member of the 3. Vojvodina Division.
appMap.description_rs: Mošin grob je izletište posvećeno partizanu Bošku Sanadroviću Moši, članu Treće vojvođanske brigade.
appMap.description_long_en: Mošin grob je izletište posvećeno partizanu Bošku Sanadroviću Moši, članu Treće vojvođanske brigade. Nalazi se odmah uz Partizanski put. Moša se istakao kao jedan od organizatora i učesnika u napadu na nemački garnizon u selu Grgurevci. Prilikom borbe teško je ranjen, nakon čega je podlegao ranama. Zbog brzog povlačenja vojske sahranjen je na obližnjoj livadi. U čast njemu ovo izletište i nosi naziv po njegovom nadimku.
appMap.description_long_rs: Mošin grob je izletište posvećeno partizanu Bošku Sanadroviću Moši, članu Treće vojvođanske brigade. Nalazi se odmah uz Partizanski put. Moša se istakao kao jedan od organizatora i učesnika u napadu na nemački garnizon u selu Grgurevci. Prilikom borbe teško je ranjen, nakon čega je podlegao ranama. Zbog brzog povlačenja vojske sahranjen je na obližnjoj livadi. U čast njemu ovo izletište i nosi naziv po njegovom nadimku.

appMap.description_en: Many call it the Savić’s house, or the Srem house. It used to belong to the rich merchant family Savić.
appMap.description_rs: Mnogi je nazivaju i Savićeva kuća ili Sremska kuća, pletara. Nekada je pripadala bogatoj trgovačkoj porodici Savić.
appMap.description_long_en:
The foundations are made from broken rock, the walls are a mix of mud and wattle, while the roof is covered in reed. This house has three floors: a basement, ground floor, and the attic with the traditional layout of rooms: kitchen - room. The kitchen area has the fireplace. There’s a porch on the three sides of the house, which is made of oak and artisanal details. This type of building was most common in Srem in the 18th century.

The house was restored in 2013 and now belongs to the Regional Institute for Protection of Cultural Monuments.
appMap.description_long_rs:
Mnogi je nazivaju i Savićeva kuća ili Sremska kuća, pletara. Nekada je pripadala bogatoj trgovačkoj porodici Savić.

Temelji su sačinjeni od lomljenog kamena, zidovi kuće od kombinacije pruća i blata, dok je krov prekriven trskom. Ovu kuću karakterišu tri nivoa: podrum, prizemlje i tavan sa tradicionalnim rasporedom prostorija u nizu soba: kuhinja – soba. U kuhinjskom delu se nalazi ognjište. Sa tri strane kuće se proteže u hrastovini izrezbaren ukrasima trem (gonak). Ovaj tip gradnje bio je zastupljen na područiju Srema u XVIII veku.

Kuća je renovirana 2013. i nalazi se u vlasništvu Pokrajinskog zavoda za zaštitu spomenika kulture.

appMap.description_en: At the exit from the Bešenovački Prnjavor, next to the main bend, left behind the farm in the valley, you’ll find the Grandpa’s Spring
appMap.description_rs: Na izlazu iz Bešenovačkog Prnjavora, posle glavne okuke, levo iza atara u udolini, nalazi se Dedina česma.
appMap.description_long_en: At the exit from the Bešenovački Prnjavor, next to the main bend, left behind the farm in the valley, you’ll find the Grandpa’s Spring. To get to the spring, climb the concrete steps, and find it hidden in cool shade, nested in growing moss. It’s unfinished and has no sink or tubes, but it’s certainly not what you’d expect when you hear the name of the spring.
appMap.description_long_rs: Na izlazu iz Bešenovačkog Prnjavora, posle glavne okuke, levo iza atara u udolini, nalazi se Dedina česma. Do izvora vode betonske stepenice, a sam izvor obrastao je u zelenilo i ušuškan je u prijatnu hladovinu. Nedovršeno i bez česme, svakako nije mesto koje očekujete kada čujete naziv izvora.

appMap.description_en: The russian hero and holder of the Medal of the Patriotic War II order and the Medal of the Red Star. Sacrificed his life in the fight against fascists at Frušk
appMap.description_rs: Ruski heroj nosilac Ordena Otadžbinskog rata II reda i Ordena crvene zvezde. Dao je život za slobodu boreći se protiv fašista na Fruškoj gori.
appMap.description_long_en:
Mihail Zaharovič Galanov (Михаил Зачарович Галанов) was born in 1915 in Siberia (exact location unknown), and died at Fruška Gora on December 4, 1994. He was a lieutenant of the Soviet army guard and commander of the mortar platoon. Mihail holds two medals, the Medal of the Patriotic War II order and the Medal of the Red Star. He was awarded both in 1944 for his valiant war efforts in Ukraine.

His untimely death was inflicted by a sniper round, while he was ordering the 82mm mortar platoon in an effort to help the 8th Brigade of the 1st Proletarian Division. They were trying to break the front line north of Erdevik. In 2 war days, he neutralised two German machine guns and a mortar battery, and thereby caused the enemy great losses in manpower. He was posthumously awarded with the Soviet Medal of Patriotic War, 1st class, on December 14, 1944.

He was buried in a local cemetery in Stara Bingula, where a statue was raised in his name. It’s interesting that he’s buried at a local cemetery, amongst the graves of farmers, and that he’s the only soldier of the soviet army that rests there. The statue was restored in autumn, 2015.
appMap.description_long_rs:
Mihail Zaharovič Galanov (Михаил Зачарович Галанов) rođen je 1915. godine u Sibiru (tačno mesto nepoznato), a poginuo na Fruškoj gori 4. 12. 1944. Bio je poručnik garde Sovjetske armije i komandant minobacačkog voda i nosilac dva ordena: Ordena Otadžbinskog rata II reda i Ordena crvene zvezde. Ova odličja je stekao 1944. godine ratnim zaslugama boreći se u Ukrajini.

Usmrćen je hicem iz snajpera dok je rukovodio minobacačkim vodom od 82 milimetra koji je davao vatrenu podršku 8. brigadi I proleterske divizije prilikom proboja linije fronta severno od Erdevika. Za dva dana borbe je neutralisao dva nemačka mitraljeza i minobacačku bateriju, i pritom naneo neprijatelju velike gubitke u ljudstvu. Posthumno je nagrađen sovjetskim Ordenom Otadžbinskog rata I reda, ukazom od 14. 12. 1944.

Sahranjen je na mesnom groblju u Staroj Binguli, gde mu je i podignut spomenik. Interesantno je da je sahranjen na lokalnom groblju, među grobovima žitelja i da je jedini pripadnik sovjetske vojske koji tamo počiva. Spomenik je obnovljen u jesen 2015. godine.

appMap.description_en: This spring is located in the fields of Lug, near the playground, but whimsically hidden from prying eyes.
appMap.description_rs: Ovaj izvor se nalazi u luškim atarima nedelako od igrališta, neodoljivo skriven od slučajnih prolaznika.
appMap.description_long_en: This spring is located in the fields of Lug, near the playground, but whimsically hidden from prying eyes. It is encircled with tall shrubbery and trees, and you can only tell there is a spring here thanks to the mild murmur of running water.
appMap.description_long_rs: Ovaj izvor se nalazi u luškim atarima nedelako od igrališta, neodoljivo skriven od slučajnih prolaznika. Opkoljen je visokim žbunjem i drvećem, i tek slab žubor vode može vam nagovestiti da se ovde nalazi izvor.

appMap.description_en: From the Kesten viewpoint you can see a majestic view of Novi Sad and the southern slopes of Fruška Gora.
appMap.description_rs: S vidikovca Kesten pruža se veličanstven pogled na Novi Sad i južne delove Fruške gore.
appMap.description_long_en: From the Kesten viewpoint you can see a majestic view of Novi Sad and the southern slopes of Fruška Gora. If you go from Rakovac or Stari Ledinci towards Kesten, you’re in for an exciting walk and great locations like the Rakovac hermitage and the Neven spring.
appMap.description_long_rs: S vidikovca Kesten pruža se veličanstven pogled na Novi Sad i južne delove Fruške gore. Krenete li iz Rakovca ili iz Starih ledinaca ka Kestenu, čeka vas uzbudljiva šetnja i interesantne lokacije poput Rakovačke isposnice i izvora Neven.

appMap.description_en: There’s a great view of the Fruška Gora glade from the spacious meadow in Grabovo.
appMap.description_rs: S prostrane livade u Grabovu pruža se prelep prizor na živopisni fruškogorski proplanak.
appMap.description_long_en: There’s a great view of the Fruška Gora glade from the spacious meadow in Grabovo. You can catch kettle there most of the time. There’s also a remarkable old oak tree that forms a small green island with some shrubbery near it. There’s water jutting forth from beneath the oak, so this spring, even while it isn’t safe for drinking, is still called the “spring beneath the oak”.
appMap.description_long_rs: S prostrane livade u Grabovu pruža se prelep prizor na živopisni fruškogorski proplanak. Na livadi se najčešće može zateći stoka koja se izvodi na ispašu. Upečatljiv je i stari hrast koji zajedno sa žbunjem formira malo zeleno ostrvo na sredini livade. Ispod hrasta izbija voda, pa ovo mesto, iako voda nije za piće, nazivaju „Izvor ispod Hrasta“.

appMap.description_en: Valley of Chestnuts, is located in Čerević, near the children’s resort “Testera”, and Andrevlje resort.
appMap.description_rs: Dolina kestenova se nalazi u Čereviću, u blizini dečjeg odmarališta „Testera“ i odmarališta na Andrevlju.
appMap.description_long_en: Valley of Chestnuts is located in Čerević, near the children’s resort “Testera”, and Andrevlje resort. This promenade is known for its many chestnut trees, after which it was named. The chestnuts were planted to increase the biodiversity of this part of Fruška Gora. The place is ideal for rest and relaxation and picnics, furnished with tables and benches. There is also a stream nearby which completes the pleasant atmosphere.
appMap.description_long_rs: Dolina kestenova se nalazi u Čereviću, u blizini dečjeg odmarališta „Testera“ i odmarališta na Andrevlju. Ovo šetalište prepoznatljivo je i nosi ime po kestenu koji je ovde zastupljen u većoj meri. Kestenovi su zasađeni kako bi se povećao biodiverzitet ovog dela Fruške ogre. Idealno je za odmor i piknik, s obzirom na to da postoje stolovi i klupe, a u blizini se nalazi i potočić koji upotpunjuje prijatnu atmosferu.

appMap.description_en: This gorgeous picnic area is located near the Bešenovački Prnjavor, near the Mala Remeta monastery.
appMap.description_rs: Ovo predivno izletište nalazi se nedaleko od Bešenovačkog Prnjavora, u blizini manastira Mala Remeta.
appMap.description_long_en:
This gorgeous picnic area is located near the Bešenovački Prnjavor, near the Mala Remeta monastery. It’s a bit further off road, unlike most picnic areas, but the tracks in the ground and the signs will lead you to it. As soon as you see a beaufitul vista of lower Srem, you’ll know you’re at the right spot. There’s also a summer house, some benches and tables, as well as a small humble playground for kids, so this spot is great for resting and family gatherings.

The national hero Boško Palkovljević Pinki died in 1942 at the Široke Ledine, and you can find his statue not far from here.
appMap.description_long_rs:
Ovo predivno izletište nalazi se nedaleko od Bešenovačkog Prnjavora, u blizini manastira Mala Remeta. Nije uz put za razliku od većine izletišta, ali će vas utabani put i znakovi odvesti na lokaciju.
